If it looks like a rape and acts like a rape... It is a rape, unless the accused isn't conscious of what his body's doing.' Mr. McGarrett (victim's father) physically attacks Dan: 'Back off! Mr. McGarrett, I understand that you're upset...' Father: 'He raped Kristi. What are you gonna do about that?' Detective: 'There's nothing we can do. He has a medical condition that made him unaware of his actions.'
notes: Dan is tagged as 'partially_involved' because he did have non-consensual sex with Kristi, but lacked mens rea due to genuine medical condition (sexsomnia). He is innocent of the ACCUSATION (intentional rape/murder), but not entirely blameless. Exposed to family (victim's father and sister Kristi). Father physically attacks him. Detectives use coercive language suggesting murder. Legal system recognizes medical defense and cannot charge. Severity 3 due to physical assault and family exposure.

quote_or_scene: Detectives enter classroom: 'Mrs. Trent? Can we speak to you a minute?' Then in hallway: 'Please turn around, face the wall, and put your hands behind your back.' Student Ryan and entire class witness. Later: 'The school suspended her.' Sarah's husband: 'She didn't pick up when I called last night. I just figured she was sleeping.' Sarah begs at hospital: 'Please don't tell my husband.' Later evidence proves Shane hired prostitutes to practice rape scenario and fabricated photos. Prostitute Monique: 'Last time I screwed Shane he was bragging that he did his teacher. Ripping her clothes off, just how he practiced with me.'
tags: teacher; arrested_at_work; public_confrontation; suspended; media_outing; fabricated_claim; forced_abortion_exposed; marriage_threatened; wrongful_arrest
notes: Sarah is arrested in front of her entire English class, creating maximum workplace humiliation. She is suspended from her job. The investigation forces her to get an abortion to hide the pregnancy from her husband (who has fertility issues), but police seize the fetus for DNA evidence, exposing everything. Her husband learns about the abortion at the hospital and initially rejects her ('You killed a child'). She also faces media exposure outside her apartment. The case against her collapses when prostitutes reveal Shane hired them to practice rape scenarios and fabricated the pornographic photos he claimed showed Sarah. Shane ultimately confesses to raping Sarah, admitting he 'couldn't stop' due to claimed sex addiction. Sarah suffers severe harm across work, family, legal, and social domains - arrested publicly, marriage nearly destroyed, forced medical procedure exposed, reputation ruined. Police never apologize. At end, Sarah's husband bitterly notes: 'That kid raped my wife, and he gets a million bucks. What does Sarah get? She gets nothing.'

police_conduct_quote: You laid low, you came home and beat the crap out of your wife... a crushing debt of a nagging wife?
quote_or_scene: Detectives publicly confront Ben at hospital: 'Get the hell away from my door. You've got people thinking I tried to kill my wife.' Later at home: 'This is a warrant for your DNA.' Tina Parven: 'I can't believe Ben would hurt Karin.'
notes: Ben was publicly accused at hospital in front of group therapy friends/family. FBI eventually cleared him as he was with them during attack. Neighbors, employer, wife's family all told he was prime suspect. His daughter Katie initially thought he might be involved. DNA test proved he didn't rape his wife. Actual attacker was Alex Parven (son of Joel Parven, who did have affair/raped Karin).

police_conduct_quote: Your marriage is hanging by a thread. She's not gonna get rid of it, so you bash her head in.
quote_or_scene: Katie identifies Joel's voice: 'Come here, baby. You smell good.' Detectives accuse him: 'You got her pregnant. When we started this, we were both separated... I went there to make a clean break of it, and I ended up in her bed.' His wife Tina learns of affair and takes their son Andrew, leaving Joel.
notes: Joel had consensual affair with Karin and got her pregnant, but did NOT attack her. Katie identified his voice as the rapist initially. He was interrogated and his wife learned of the affair, leading to family breakup and her taking their son. However, he WAS guilty of the affair/rape (unclear if consensual throughout), so this is 'partially_involved' - innocent of ATTACK but guilty of sexual relationship that may have been rape. Wife Tina: 'Gone. She took Andrew.' Consequence is family dissolution due to exposure of affair during investigation.

quote_or_scene: Detectives question Dr. Morgan: 'And you think that someone was me?' DNA cleared him. Already facing wrongful birth lawsuit from Nicholsons.
notes: Dr. Morgan was questioned as suspect due to motive (lawsuit). DNA cleared him. Exposure remained at police level only - no public accusation or workplace notification shown. Already had preexisting workplace allegation via lawsuit. No significant harm from SVU investigation itself, just private questioning. Excluded from person_rows due to police_only exposure and no material harm shown.

quote_or_scene: Detectives question Jackie and her father about threats to Kate Simes. Father says: 'Shut up, Jackie' and 'You'd be pissed too. Might even make a few threats. Might even do more than that.' Daughter responds: 'Are you kidding? He doesn't have the guts to kill anyone.' Father provides alibi: 'Call the Tolerance Center. I've got a Rabbi, an Imam, and a catholic priest who can vouch for my whereabouts.'
notes: Jackie Solomon was Kate Simes's student. Kate reported Jackie for making offensive anti-Muslim video and sent letters to colleges Jackie was applying to. Jackie's father made threats and hang-up calls to Kate. Squad questioned both in front of each other about murder. Father provided alibi (Tolerance Center classes). Cleared immediately via alibi verification. Public exposure occurred during joint parent-child interrogation where murder accusation was made explicit.

quote_or_scene: Detective: 'Threats and hang-up calls sound normal to you?' Solomon: 'Sure I was extreme. But do you have any idea how much money I've donated to the Heller School? What about my right to exercise free speech?' Detective: 'You must be their star pupils.' Solomon: 'I told you threatening Miss Simes was a bad idea.' Detective: 'Might even make a few threats. Might even do more than that.' Solomon: 'Are you kidding? He doesn't have the guts to kill anyone.'
notes: Mr. Solomon openly admitted making threats to Kate Simes ('threatened Miss Simes') and hang-up calls over college application interference. Squad questioned him and daughter together about Kate's murder with clear implication he killed her ('Might even do more than that'). Daughter had to defend father in front of detectives. Cleared via alibi (Tolerance Center with clergy). Public humiliation occurred during joint interrogation with daughter present where murder was directly suggested.

police_conduct_quote: You got a temper, Edgar. She challenged your authority. She emasculated you in front of the entire group. Pay her back by making her one of the boys? ... You strangling her and cutting off her breasts.
quote_or_scene: Edgar is arrested and interrogated. Detectives show him crime scene photos and accuse him of murder based on his urban exploration video showing Tina. He denies involvement. Later cleared when supervisor provides alibi.
notes: Edgar was questioned aggressively about murdering Tina Snow. Detectives accused him of emasculation-motivated murder. Cleared when his supervisor alibied him for working off the books loading lumber.

police_conduct_quote: We know about your special relationship with Morten. How do you think we got to you? Robert told us. He told us everything. How you killed Tina Snow to make him look innocent.
quote_or_scene: Detectives tell Jasper that Morten gave him up. 'We know about your special relationship with Morten. How do you think we got to you? Robert told us.' Jasper confesses to killing Tina, describing details. Later proven innocent when supervisor provides alibi for working off the books.
notes: Jasper Grice, Morten's former cellmate, was told that Morten betrayed him. Under this deception, he confessed to murdering Tina Snow. His supervisor then provided an alibi proving he was working during both murders. Classic false confession obtained through deceptive interrogation tactics.

police_conduct_quote: You're the sicko dreaming these up. ... Now I don't know what's sicker, you thinking this up, or people actually paying for it.
quote_or_scene: Detectives execute search warrant at Harrison's home/studio. 'You can't just come in. You have no right.' 'Well, the warrant says we do.' They accuse him: 'You're the sicko dreaming these up.' Find Ted Bundy merchandise. Later cleared when alibi with inker verified.
notes: Harrison Thomas, graphic novel artist, had his home searched with warrant. Detectives called him 'sicko' and questioned his work. His alibi with his inker was verified. Later mistakenly suspected of the precinct bombing based on tattoo identification, but actual bomber was someone else.

quote_or_scene: Kona arrested publicly at Madison Square Garden after championship fight. Press and crowd present. Lawyer produces gym surveillance video proving alibi. Released. Victim's father Terry Donovan shoots and kills Kona at SVU precinct: 'That was for Julie.' Kona dies.
notes: Kona's DNA found in victim from consensual encounter earlier. Had consensual sex with Julie (on video). Surveillance video proves he was at gym during murder. Publicly arrested at championship fight in front of massive crowd and press. Released when alibi proven. Victim's father immediately shoots and kills him outside SVU precinct.

police_conduct_quote: Detectives bring Jadon's addicted mother to interrogation room. Mother begs: 'I'm so sick and tired of being sick and tired... I'm hurting so bad, Jadon. I don't want to kick in prison. I need to get well.' Detective offers deal: 'You talk, she walks out of here tonight.' Jadon confesses falsely to save his mother from withdrawal.
quote_or_scene: Hudson University Dean: 'I have a duty to protect my students from thugs.' Expels Jadon and Ezra immediately upon learning of investigation. Jadon falsely confesses: 'I killed Julie Donovan... After we had sex, I was walking her home and tried to rob her. She started fighting me off, so I beat on her.' Judge accepts guilty plea. Later proven Jimmy Mac killed Julie; gang set up Odami brothers. At end: 'I talked to the Dean, you guys are back in school.'
notes: Foster kid with straight A's, full scholarship to Hudson University. Gang leader Jimmy Mac set him up for murder as retaliation for leaving gang. Detectives used his addicted mother as leverage to obtain false confession. Dean expelled him immediately. Faced life sentence. Proven innocent when prostitute Latrice reveals Jimmy Mac actually killed Julie. Charges dropped, reinstated to college.

quote_or_scene: Hudson Dean to detectives: 'I have a duty to protect my students from thugs... I'm expelling them.' Detective: 'What happened to innocent until proven guilty?' Dean: 'You said you were looking for a murderer.' Ezra expelled immediately. At end, cleared and returned to school with brother.
notes: Jadon's brother, also foster kid with straight A's at Hudson University on scholarship. Gang leader Jimmy Mac set up both brothers for murder. Had consensual sex with Julie at party (she 'was really feeling Ezra'). Actually innocent - Jimmy Mac killed Julie when she refused to falsely accuse brothers of rape. Dean expelled him immediately upon learning of investigation. Charges dropped, reinstated to college.

quote_or_scene: Gilbert is questioned about Jodi: 'Did you bang her, Casanova?' 'If you mean, were we intimate? Yes.' 'Did you kill her?' 'What? Are you saying she's dead?' Later confirmed his DNA would match sheets but he left before the murder.
notes: Gilbert had consensual sex with Jodi but left before the murder. He was questioned as a suspect but cleared when timeline showed he wasn't present during the murder. Questioning was private with no public exposure or material consequences beyond the interview itself.

police_conduct_quote: Hey, if she put up a fight and went into the river by accident, you know, maybe it's not your fault. Who is she?
quote_or_scene: STABLER: 'You fell running away from us. After you gave my partner a right hook to the jaw.' Jesse has epilepsy, was postictal, and detective used leading questions: 'She was so beautiful. I have a weakness for younger women. I killed her?'
notes: Jesse confessed during postictal state after epileptic seizure. ME Warner explicitly warns detectives he is 'highly prone to suggestion' and they asked 'leading questions'. Proven innocent via surveillance footage showing he was sleeping at bodega until 10:30am, couldn't have been at crime scene. Exposure remained police_only (interrogation room), but suffered arrest, physical injury from seizure/fall, and coerced false confession. Severity 2 for arrest and interrogation despite no public exposure.

police_conduct_quote: BENSON: 'Here's what I think. You brought a 14-year-old girl over from Nigeria to be your wife. After spending a year in America, she decides, you know, instead of a circumcision, I'd rather have an iPhone. So she tries to bolt, you beat her to death and dump her in the East River.'
quote_or_scene: When detectives arrive at Chukwei's home, they confront him in front of his family. BENSON at door: 'Does Nikkiel Kwambe live here?' Then Chukwei runs and STABLER pursues: 'Stop! Police! Police! Don't move!' Arrested violently despite broken arm: 'My arm is broken! Please believe me!' STABLER: 'If he moves, shoot him.' Later interrogated: 'You beat her to death and dump her in the East River.'
tags: wrong_ID; public_confrontation; ruined_in_family; arrested; immigrant; disabled; witness_intimidation_victim
notes: Chukwei was Nikki's husband and a witness against Dennis King. Police suspected him of murdering Nikki when he ran (due to PTSD from Nigerian political imprisonment). Arrested violently in front of family despite having broken/crippled arm. Proven innocent via alibi: security cameras show him entering shop at 7am during murder timeframe. Actual killer was his first wife Sarah Flint. Suffered: public arrest in front of family, accusatory interrogation, protective custody separation from family, and ultimately his wife Sarah was convicted. Severity 3 for arrest, family exposure, material disruption to family life, and traumatic re-victimization given his history of police torture in Nigeria.

police_conduct_quote: You get jealous? [...] Want to teach her a lesson? [...] You love him so much that you were willing to kill to get him. [...] You're running out of excuses.
quote_or_scene: Detectives aggressively question Doug about Shelby's murder, implying he killed her out of jealousy over her affair with Tony. Doug is brought to the station and interrogated. Later cleared when Tony's alibi checks out and Cassidy/Cole are identified as killers.
notes: Doug was Shelby's boyfriend and initial primary suspect. Detectives confronted him about her affair with Tony and accused him of murder out of jealousy. He was subjected to aggressive interrogation tactics but not publicly exposed beyond the police station. Eventually cleared when street family identified as perpetrators.

police_conduct_quote: You jealous, too, there, stud? [...] You wanted Shelby dead. With her out of the picture, Doug's all yours. [...] You love him so much that you were willing to kill to get him.
quote_or_scene: Anna is arrested at her home (parents are out of town) while in bed, brought to station in her underwear. Detectives accuse her of killing Shelby out of jealousy because Anna was sleeping with Doug. They put her in interrogation room with Doug to create conflict: 'Put the rats in the cage. Let them fight it out.' Physical altercation ensues between Doug and Anna.
notes: Anna was in park with Shelby (confirmed by voicemail) which made her a strong suspect. Detectives arrested her at home while she was in bed and brought her to station. They orchestrated a confrontation with Doug where physical violence occurred. Her sexual relationship with Doug (Shelby's boyfriend) was exposed during investigation. Cleared when street family identified.

police_conduct_quote: What in the hell is that supposed to... / Were you close? Intimate? Did you want to be, and she said no?
quote_or_scene: Benson and Cooper confront Robb in Central Park: 'We heard that you like to control things, especially the ground. You ever try to control Kate Barrow?' / 'Were you close? Intimate? Did you want to be, and she said no?' / 'I asked her out. She refused. End of story.' / 'Kate Barrow was murdered, Mr. Robb.'
notes: Robb is questioned aggressively in the park after Kate Barrow's family describes him as 'pushy' and 'controlling.' Detectives imply he may have killed her when she rejected him. He is immediately cleared once Larry Moore is identified as the Woodsman. No evidence of public exposure beyond the initial confrontation; no lasting consequences shown. Questioning is confrontational but brief. Severity rated 1 because exposure appears limited to the detectives with no wider audience or material harm demonstrated.

police_conduct_quote: I know guys like you can't stay away from little boys. It's only a matter of time. So I'll be waiting for you.
quote_or_scene: Detectives confront Jacob at Torah Veyirah school in front of Beit Din, students, and Rabbi. Rabbi Iskowitz states 'Jacob Ribowsky's comportment has been in complete accordance with Torah law' suggesting prior community discussion. Detective says threateningly: 'I know guys like you can't stay away from little boys.' Jacob later proves alibi with girlfriend Faith at Roxy theater all day. Stabler later apologizes: 'I'm sorry I accused you of molesting David.'
tags: wrong_ID; public_confrontation; school_alert; ruined_in_family; teacher; witness_recant
notes: Community had already investigated and cleared him via Beit Din before detectives arrived, issuing public statement of support. Detectives publicly accused him at his workplace (school) in front of religious court, students, and leadership. Could not initially provide alibi because revealing he was at movies with girlfriend would cause shunning in Hasidic community. Alibi later confirmed by Roxy theater manager. Suffered public humiliation and threatening statements from police despite being innocent.

quote_or_scene: Detectives find Faith kissing her brother (Jacob's student) and immediately assume sexual abuse. Detective yells 'Get off him' and 'What the hell's going on here?' Faith explains: 'We've been in love for a year. But in our community, we can't even hold hands until we get married... I couldn't tell you in front of the Beit Din. I would have been shunned.' She provides alibi that she was with Jacob at Roxy theater all day during the crime.
notes: Faith was confronted by detectives who misinterpreted her kissing her younger brother (whom she was tutoring). Detectives assumed she was involved in child abuse. She had to publicly reveal her secret relationship with Jacob to clear both of them, which could result in shunning from her Hasidic community. The accusation was based on detective misinterpretation of an innocent familial kiss. Her alibi (at movies with Jacob) was later verified.

police_conduct_quote: Well, don't lie to me, Cyrus. My partner is in that ambulance with the girl. She's gonna tell us who attacked her.
quote_or_scene: Detective finds Cyrus in garden with machete near where Ashley was found. Stabler: 'So, what happened to you, you get carried away, take it out on the girl?' Cyrus: 'No, I only came out to kill the rats and squirrels in my garden.' Stabler threatens him about Ashley identifying attacker. Uniform cop says: 'He's all yours, Detective' implying arrest/detention. Cleared when no evidence connects him.
notes: Gardener confronted publicly by police with machete as 'murder weapon.' Threatened and detained in front of other officer/neighbors. Quickly cleared but experienced public accusation and police threats.

person_label: Foster father (Hank, last name not given)
quote_or_scene: Fin: 'I still like the foster dad for it.' Benson: 'Or maybe you're just looking for a reason to keep investigating.' Captain: 'You got the rest of the day. Find something or move on.' ACS check shows foster parents clean. Investigation pivots away when uncle Rick becomes primary suspect.
notes: Foster father suspected by detectives but no evidence of public confrontation shown. ACS verified he was clean. Investigation moved on to uncle. Minimal harm documented but suspicion was present. Listed for completeness but consequence_severity is 1 due to lack of documented public exposure or material harm.

police_conduct_quote: Stabler: 'You don't love Ashley. If you did, you'd be telling me who raped her. You're only gonna protect him.' [Strongly implies Rick knows rapist and is complicit]
quote_or_scene: ACS worker: 'I found them in bed together. He was naked... I filed on him. But Ashley loves her uncle, denied everything.' Stabler confronts Rick: 'Uncle Rick would never hurt me' (Ashley). Fin: 'You're looking at ten years for possession' (pills and marijuana). Rick arrested but reveals prison guard connection. Stabler accuses him of protecting rapist. Rick ultimately helps by revealing guard connection, proving innocent of THIS rape but guilty of drug involvement and boundary violations with Ashley years earlier.
notes: Rick Tyler is PARTIALLY_INVOLVED: he was inappropriate with Ashley years ago (found naked in bed with her at age 10) but is innocent of the current rape. He was arrested for drug possession and confronted about the rape. Since he has preexisting history and did commit drug crimes, his innocence is partial. However, he was publicly suspected/arrested in THIS case (the current rape) which he did not commit. Police threatened him and he was arrested, though exposure was limited to police interrogation. Including because he faced legal consequences (arrest) for a crime (this rape) he didn't commit, even though he had other misconduct.

quote_or_scene: Elliot investigating: 'CO Matthew Parker, 36. No criminal record, but a couple complaints from his wife... maybe she left him after finding his porn collection. Our boy here's got 16 subscriptions to hardcore websites.' Fin: 'A guy who can't get it any other way, unless he's raping inmates.' Later, Harris's lawyer: 'CDC traced Ashley's infection back to a group home... She didn't catch it from him.' Defense lawyer: 'We expedited the test results. Captain Harris is negative for TB. As is Matthew Parker, the other officer you named in your witch hunt.'
notes: Matthew Parker was investigated and publicly named by defense attorney as being part of SVU's 'witch hunt.' His personal life (porn subscriptions, divorce) was investigated and he was suspected of being a rapist. TB test proved he was innocent. Named in open court/legal proceedings as wrongly accused. This constitutes workplace exposure and reputation damage, earning severity 2.

consequence_detail: perp_walk, arrested, charged, convicted_then_exonerated, gay_outing, hate_crime_assault, near_death, career_ending_injury, permanent_brain_damage, lost_marriage
police_conduct_quote: You lost control. Jeremy died. ... I didn't want to hurt him. I loved him. (Detective supplies narrative, Lincoln adopts it in confused state after coma)
quote_or_scene: Lincoln arrested at hospital bedside after waking from coma from hate crime beating. 'Lincoln, we're here to arrest you. You have the right to remain silent.' Later exonerated when Gary Lesley confesses: 'I didn't mean to kill him.' Lincoln tells detectives: 'I was there. I remember fighting. I thought I must have done it.' Final scene: 'I had it all. A career, someone I loved. Football gave me everything. And then took it all away.'
tags: ruined_physically; ruined_at_work; ruined_in_family; perp_walk; media_outing; coerced_confession; cop; public_confrontation; vigilante_attack; career_ending; life_destroyed
notes: Lincoln is the primary false suspect. He is publicly outed as gay (which destroys his endorsement deals and career prospects), arrested on camera at the hospital, charged with murder, tried, and convicted. Between arrest and trial, he survives a hate crime beating that leaves him in a coma with permanent brain damage, ending his football career. His confession was coerced while he was disoriented after the coma. He is later exonerated when his agent Gary Lesley confesses to the actual murder. The harm cascade is catastrophic: outing → hate crime → brain injury → false conviction → career loss → loss of husband (murdered). Severity 4 due to near-death experience, permanent disability, wrongful conviction, and total life destruction.

police_conduct_quote: Detective: 'So you killed him?' When Freddie denies: 'Well, you just admitted to beating the crap out of him.' And: 'Then why's your blood all over his apartment?' Accusatory throughout interview at workplace.
quote_or_scene: Detectives confront Freddie at gym workplace in front of manager Candayce. 'Where were you last night?' 'So you killed him?' Blood evidence mentioned publicly. Manager already suspects Freddie of theft ('sticky fingers'). Freddie cleared when alibi confirmed and blood explained as nosebleed during basketball viewing.
notes: Freddie is a homeless gay teen who volunteered at shelter and knew Jeremy. Detectives interview him at his gym job in front of his manager, who already suspects him of theft. They accuse him of murder publicly. His blood at the scene is explained (nosebleed during sports viewing), and his alibi (shelter curfew, security camera) clears him. The public workplace accusation in front of a suspicious boss constitutes exposure and reputational harm, warranting severity 2.

police_conduct_quote: Detective: 'What else you do for him, Sam?' ... 'Come on. He liked to get choked. Maybe you squeezed too hard. It was an accident?' ... 'You go to work, you wait for his boss to raise the alarm, then you go back to your love nest and you find him?'
quote_or_scene: Sam found Jeremy's body, removed sex toys and ball gag to protect Jeremy's reputation, changed his clothes. Detectives immediately suggest sexual relationship and accidental killing during rough sex. 'We weren't lovers.' 'Come on. He liked to get choked. Maybe you squeezed too hard.' Sam cleared by workplace alibi (15 witnesses) and DNA.
notes: Sam is Jeremy's personal assistant who discovered the body. Detectives immediately theorize a sexual relationship and accidental death during S&M. Coercive interrogation tactics used ('love nest,' 'squeezed too hard'). However, exposure remains police_only with no evidence it spread to workplace or public. Cleared by solid alibi and DNA. Severity 1: private interrogation stress but no public exposure or material consequence.

police_conduct_quote: You're an idiot... You sexually abused a girl because a voice on the phone told you to.
quote_or_scene: Stabler to Lomax: 'You strip-searched a teenage girl and kept her naked in your office for 30 minutes?' Lomax: 'I was just following Detective Milgram's orders.' Stabler: 'There is no Detective Milgram. Whole thing was a scam.' Lomax: 'Oh, my God.'
notes: Lomax was manipulated by phone hoaxer Merritt Rook posing as 'Detective Milgram.' Lomax believed he was following legitimate police orders. He was arrested in front of HappiBurger staff/public for sexual abuse. The episode frames him as a victim of manipulation ('victim of corporate America,' 'lemmings'), though he still faces criminal charges (3-6 years mentioned). His innocence is in the sense that he had no independent sexual motive—he was coerced/deceived into committing the acts. Police show no empathy, calling him an idiot. Severity 3: arrested publicly, charged, career/reputation destroyed.

quote_or_scene: Suicide note: 'Detective Milgram won't stop calling me. He says I'm going to prison for murder. I never meant to harm that woman and her baby. God forgive me.' Nurse: 'Mr. Rook lost it. Said he'd kill Dr. Slifkin.'
notes: Dr. Slifkin was targeted by Merritt Rook (again posing as Detective Milgram) with repeated harassing phone calls accusing him of murder after a patient (Rook's wife Juliet) died in childbirth due to medical error. The calls were psychologically coercive ('He says I'm going to prison for murder'). Slifkin's suicide note indicates he was innocent of intentional murder—he made a medical mistake ('I never meant to harm') but was driven to kill himself by Rook's relentless accusations. His wife received the note, so family exposure occurred. The insurance company ruled it suicide, not accident. Episode frames Slifkin as a victim of Rook's manipulation campaign. Severity 4: death by suicide directly caused by false accusation of murder.

police_conduct_quote: Detectives reveal in front of father that 'Big Pierson here's Jenna's baby daddy' and 'you screwed her?' deliberately baiting family conflict
quote_or_scene: PJ attacks father after learning he slept with fiancée: 'You slept with my fiancee, you son of a bitch?' Father throws PJ through window. 'Somebody call an ambulance.' Later detective admits: 'We didn't throw PJ through that window. His father did. After your detectives baited them so they'd turn on each other.'
notes: PJ is initially suspected of murdering his fiancée Jenna. Detectives use coercive interrogation tactics, deliberately revealing father's affair with Jenna in confrontational setting. This provokes violent family conflict resulting in PJ being thrown through window requiring ambulance. Later evidence suggests father (Pierson Sr.) is actual killer acting from jealousy. PJ ultimately clears himself by providing evidence against father. Defense attorney explicitly states detectives 'baited them so they'd turn on each other.' PJ suffers severe physical injury as direct consequence of detectives' tactics during accusation process.

police_conduct_quote: Detective to Pierson Sr.: 'You found out about the baby. And Jenna was gonna bleed PJ for child support. You didn't want her getting her hooks into half your company. So you told PJ to handle it... But you didn't think that he would kill her.'
quote_or_scene: Casey charges both with conspiracy: 'I'm charging you both with conspiracy to commit murder.' At trial, prosecution theory shifts when ADA reveals: 'Jenna loved your family's money. And she hit the trifecta. Marrying you, having daddy's baby, and learning the secret plans to buy the plantation. I mean, you and dad had no choice but to solve the Jenna problem.' Final scene suggests actual evidence (hidden camera footage) exonerates both Bartletts.
notes: Pierson Sr. is accused of conspiring with son to murder Jenna, then theory shifts to him being sole killer motivated by jealousy after having affair with son's fiancée. He is arrested for obstruction, publicly accused at station and during trial. Episode ends with discovery of hidden camera evidence that appears to exonerate him (transcript cuts off but detectives say 'You've never seen a performance' suggesting video will reveal true killer). Throughout, detectives use aggressive tactics including threats about business consequences and deliberately provoking family conflict. Both father and son are exposed to public accusation in presence of each other and legal counsel.

quote_or_scene: Detectives question Pinto multiple times: 'Mr. Pinto, we found your DNA on a young woman named Ana Machado.' Pinto denies knowing her. Later: 'Pinto's alibi checks out. Real killer tried to frame him.' DNA planted via sex worker who took used condom per Gomez's instructions.
notes: Arrested/questioned based on DNA match that was deliberately planted by corrupt Lt. Gomez. Alibi (photos/videos from Staten Island) ultimately clears him. Framed as part of Gomez's cover-up scheme. Exposure remained within police investigation; no evidence of public workplace/family/media exposure, so severity=3 for arrest/interrogation only.

quote_or_scene: Benson: 'What about the Catholic shelter? Father Alberto's place? Maybe he knows something.' Brady: 'He's a nice guy, but he wouldn't be the first priest with a secret.' Squad goes to question him; he runs. Struggle over gun. Father shot. Later revealed church was 'banged up' suggesting Gomez sent someone to threaten priest. Cassie testifies Gomez 'has eyes and ears everywhere.' Father's fear ('I can't' when told to drop gun) recontextualized as fear of Gomez, not guilt.
notes: Priest runs when detectives arrive to question him about shelter murders. Shot during struggle over detective's gun. Initially suspected by squad but episode reveals he was terrorized/threatened by Gomez's associates (church ransacked beyond ICE raid damage). Benson realizes 'the fear I saw in Father Alberto's eyes' indicated he was victim, not perpetrator. His death is direct consequence of being suspected/pursued. One witness saw him hugging crying girl late at night (misinterpreted as sexual; actually pastoral care). Severity=4: killed as result of accusation/pursuit.

quote_or_scene: Detectives Stabler and Tutuola confront Henry at Alony's Pub while he's working: 'Aw, not you guys again.' / 'Okay, he remember us.' / 'How about her, Henry?' [showing victim photo] / 'Never seen her before.' / 'She get raped?' / 'Who said anything about rape?' / 'You did. The last 100 times you hassled me... About that other girl, Emily.' Henry is questioned in front of bar patrons and describes being hassled 'the last 100 times' about Emily. Later cleared through voice line-up when three victims cannot identify him.
notes: Henry is publicly questioned at his workplace bar about rape accusations. The dialogue 'not you guys again' and 'the last 100 times you hassled me' indicates repeated police contact. He's accused based on: (1) flirting with victim Emily Johannes at the bar, (2) asking for her ID to see her address, (3) making sexual innuendos. Emily describes her rapist's voice as 'raspy' and 'hoarse whisper.' In the voice line-up scene, three victims (Emily, Natalie, Caitlyn) do NOT identify Henry (number 5) - they identify 'number two' or cannot make positive ID. Henry is definitively cleared. Public confrontation at workplace = severity 2.

police_conduct_quote: You sodomized his stepson with his 5-year-old's homemade baseball bat. And then he stabbed Eric Byers to death, and left him in a pool of his own blood... Tell that to yourself while you're rotting in prison.
quote_or_scene: Detective: 'Your client sodomized his stepson with his 5-year-old's homemade baseball bat. And then he stabbed Eric Byers to death, and left him in a pool of his own blood.' Kelley: 'I didn't kill anybody.' Later: 'We didn't find any blood in his truck or his home. Even his work boots don't match the prints found at the crime scene.' ME: 'Don't bother unless he's a diabetic... Either the killer doesn't know he's diabetic, or he's not taking enough insulin.' Jake Berlin is revealed as the actual killer.
notes: Sean Kelley sodomized Eric Byers with a baseball bat (confirmed assault) believing Eric molested his son Cory, but did NOT commit the murder he was arrested for. The actual murderer was Jake Berlin, a diabetic pedophile website operator. Kelley is cleared via forensic evidence (no blood transfer, wrong boot prints, killer was diabetic). Charged with murder but proven innocent of that specific charge through DNA/forensic analysis.

police_conduct_quote: Did he cry? Did he beg you to stop? ... It starts with the fantasies. Which scared you, at first. But then you started drinking, and what you wanted didn't seem so bad after all.
quote_or_scene: Detective Benson: 'My gut says that Eric Byers didn't molest his stepbrother. And I'm not comfortable with him being railroaded into prison for something that he didn't do.' Greylek: 'The little boy said he did.' Benson: 'After being coached by a man who's obsessed with revenge... If Eric had touched Cory, there would be more signs of psychological trauma.' Medical exam: 'There are no outward signs of penetration. No anal abrasions and no evidence of mucosal tears. I didn't find any sap in his throat either.' Child psychologist Dr. Engels: 'he was coached. He just shoved a crayon into a doll's ass. But there's no evidence of sexual assault to his rectum. Somebody told him what to do to raise the alarm.' Benson: 'Your son doesn't react like a victim of abuse because he's never been touched.'
notes: Eric voluntarily walked into SVU seeking help for pedophilic urges but insisted he never touched his stepbrother Cory. Medical exam found NO physical evidence of abuse. Child psychologist concluded Cory was coached by his father Sean Kelley, who was 'obsessed with revenge.' Detective Benson explicitly states Eric didn't molest Cory and the boy 'doesn't react like a victim of abuse because he's never been touched.' Eric was sodomized with a baseball bat by Sean Kelley in vigilante revenge, then murdered by Jake Berlin (who believed Eric had molested an unidentified child based on an online confession). Eric is strongly implied innocent of molesting Cory specifically, though his online confession to molesting 'a child' is never verified/victim never found. His death is a direct consequence of the false accusation by his stepfather.

quote_or_scene: McTeer confesses: 'Look, okay. Okay. I raped that girl. The other ones, too. But I swear to God, I didn't kill anyone.' His alibi is verified by Pennsylvania victim.
notes: McTeer is innocent of THIS murder but guilty of serial rapes. Included because he was the initial murder suspect and cleared, though he was arrested for the rapes he did commit.

quote_or_scene: Corliss: 'Dick, I didn't kill Marga, so why are they accusing me?' Detectives suspect him because he tracked Marga down at symposium after being banned. Administrator confirms 'Yeah, he was here' providing alibi.
notes: Already suffered career consequences from space station incident. SVU questioning adds to his distress but remains police-only exposure.

police_conduct_quote: Detectives mock him during interrogation. Stabler's violence implied when lawyer says 'Who slugged me' and detective responds 'it wasn't a cop... so in a way, it didn't happen.'
quote_or_scene: Lawyer Walsh: 'Vincent's father recognized him on last night's news.' Vince: 'I'm the family embarrassment.' Father sent high-powered attorney showing family humiliation. Vince exonerated when fingerprint on necklace proves to be Colonel Finley's, not his.
tags: media_outing; perp_walk; family_shame; rich_family; physical_assault_by_non_cop; proven_innocent_forensics
notes: Despite being a drug addict with criminal record, he was innocent of this murder. Suffered media exposure, family humiliation, and was assaulted during arrest. Father's reaction (sending lawyer to 'forestall further publicity') shows family shame is a consequence.

police_conduct_quote: Colonel Finley to detectives: 'I'll tell him to keep an eye on the folks at the Hall of Science for us.' Detectives agree, knowing Thibodaux is volatile and obsessive. They weaponize his mental illness.
quote_or_scene: Anton shoots Vincent Beckwith at Hall of Science after being manipulated by investigators. Anton: 'I did it! I got him!' Huang warned about volatility: 'Stalkers become violent when rejected... I'm not seeing the necessary volatility' then later 'That enough volatility, Doc?' Anton was mentally ill, manipulated into becoming a weapon.
notes: Anton is innocent of Marga's murder but was manipulated by police/Finley to act as surveillance, leading him to shoot Beckwith. This is life-altering harm - he will face serious criminal charges for the shooting. Police/Finley exploited his mental illness and obsession.

quote_or_scene: Alec Bernardi: 'He raped my sister and got her pregnant. That's why I cut his balls off.' Later revealed: Tina Bernardi: 'Neither did Josh. We had sex. It was... What do you call it? Consensual?' Alec misunderstood a phone conversation where Tina made a joke about Josh 'doing' her.
tags: ruined_physically; murdered; wrong_ID; witness_recant; family; custody_dispute
notes: Josh Galli, 22, homeless with schizophrenia, had consensual sex with Tina Bernardi (who was part of a pregnancy pact). Alec Bernardi overheard his sister joking on the phone about Josh and misunderstood it as rape. Alec hunted Josh down, castrated him with a scalpel, and burned him alive with formaldehyde. Josh was completely innocent of rape—the sex was consensual and initiated by Tina. The accusation originated within the family (Alec's misunderstanding) and led directly to Josh's torture-murder. This is the clearest case of fatal harm from false accusation in the episode.

quote_or_scene: Detective: 'The murder you're on the hook for.' Seth: 'Wait, we never murdered anyone.' Seth shows timestamped photos proving he was at Gansevoort Hotel rooftop bar when Josh was killed 200 feet below at 1:17 AM.
notes: Seth and Sara (Street Cleaners) were initially suspected of Josh Galli's murder because their phone's geotag placed them near the crime scene. However, they were proven innocent via timestamped photos showing they were at a rooftop bar 200 feet above the murder scene at the exact time of death. They were arrested for their videotaped assaults on homeless people but exonerated of the Galli murder. Exposure was limited to police interrogation.

quote_or_scene: Detective: 'The murder you're on the hook for.' Sara: 'Wait, we never murdered anyone.' Proven innocent via timestamped phone photos at hotel bar during time of murder.
notes: Sara, partner of Seth in Street Cleaners vigilante group, was arrested and accused of murdering Josh Galli based on phone geotag data. Proven innocent via alibi evidence (timestamped photos). Like Seth, she was guilty of other assaults on homeless people but innocent of the Galli murder. Exposure limited to police.

police_conduct_quote: Fin: 'Here's how it goes. Your cellie rolls the dice. Nine. That's how many days you get to play his girlfriend.' Shows dice: 'I gots an 11.' Stabler: 'We gots enough to lock you away right now! You'll be inside six months before you ever see trial. That's a lot of dice rolling.'
quote_or_scene: Detectives arrest Gots for tiger ownership and interrogate him aggressively about Natalie's murder. Warner later confirms: 'The DNA from the tiger that killed Natalie? Not his.' He's released but later murdered by the actual smugglers.
notes: Gots Money was arrested and subjected to coercive interrogation tactics including threats of prison rape. DNA evidence later exonerated him of the murder. However, exposure remained within law enforcement (police_only) with no evidence of public or workplace exposure. He was subsequently murdered by the actual killers (Bushido's crew using hyenas), but this murder was not a consequence of the false accusation—rather, it was because he could identify the smugglers. Since exposure was police_only and there's no evidence of public harm from the accusation itself, severity is 3 for arrest/detention rather than higher.

police_conduct_quote: Detective Benson held gun to back of Pruitt's head during arrest scene; interrogation included aggressive accusations: 'That is why you stalked her, you stabbed her, and you stuffed her into the trunk of her own car.'
quote_or_scene: Witness landlord identifies Pruitt from photo lineup as man arguing with victim. Pruitt arrested, detained, forced to provide DNA sample ('Open your mouth, or I'm going to have you restrained and have your blood drawn'), transferred to military custody for Article 32 hearing. DNA results prove he is NOT the father: 'Pruitt's DNA didn't match.' Olivia later apologizes: 'I wanted to apologize... You did your job and got justice for Jessie.' Pruitt responds: 'I knew my DNA wouldn't match. I told you. I didn't have sex with her.'
tags: wrong_ID; arrested; detained; military_hearing; coerced_confession_attempt; reputation_damage; public_confrontation
notes: Pruitt was demoted previously for 'fraternizing' with victim (consensual relationship). Had motive to help victim but was wrongly accused of rape/murder. Endured arrest with gun held to head, detention, forced DNA collection, military hearing before DNA proved innocence. Detective Benson's PTSD contributed to aggressive pursuit. Severity 3: arrested, detained, military legal proceedings, reputation harm across military community.

police_conduct_quote: Detective to Geno: 'You're a pervert.' / 'You stroked her hair, and she ran away? No, hey. Hey, that's sick. Hey, that's my kid!' / 'You mean bury her body deeper so she won't be found.'
quote_or_scene: Detectives enter the Nut Hut sex shop where Geno works. They confront him publicly in the workplace: 'Geno Parnell. Police.' Geno runs. After arrest, he's interrogated with accusatory language: 'You're a pervert,' 'Stalking her wasn't enough for you?' He insists on innocence: 'I didn't take Rosie! I was working all last night!' Later proven innocent when real kidnapper Jake is found with Rosie.
notes: Geno is accused publicly at his workplace (Nut Hut sex shop) in front of customers/coworkers. Detectives use degrading language ('pervert,' 'scum') and coercive tactics ('You mean bury her body deeper'). He's arrested and interrogated aggressively. Despite being proven innocent when the real kidnapper is caught, police offer no apology. Severity 3 due to arrest, public workplace confrontation, and aggressive interrogation creating significant harm to already marginal employment/reputation.

police_conduct_quote: Detectives threaten: 'Misty disappears, or Molly goes to jail for prostitution.' This forces her to abandon her research identity and hand over evidence.
quote_or_scene: DETECTIVE: 'I'll make you a deal. Misty disappears, or Molly goes to jail for prostitution. Now, shake it on out of here.' Molly/Misty is cleared by audio recording proving consensual encounter and alibi from bouncer.
notes: Molly was suspected based on physical evidence (her fake nail, saliva) but audio recording and bouncer alibi prove consensual encounter ended before attack. No public exposure beyond detectives. Coerced to give up research identity under threat of prostitution charges.

quote_or_scene: HAILEY: 'I did it. I tried to kill my dad.' Later cleared by Blake's alibi: 'Hailey was with us at the Tauscher-Leto warehouse on Monday night. 8:00 till 1:00 a.m.' Hailey confessed to protect Blake.
notes: Hailey falsely confessed to protect her activist friend Blake. She was proven innocent via Blake's alibi placing her at a warehouse robbery during the attack. No public exposure; interrogation occurred with guidance counselor present (not parent), making initial confession inadmissible. Never publicly accused beyond family/counselor/detectives.

quote_or_scene: Sammers: 'I swear on my life I never laid a hand on any child.' Later: 'Sammers quit teaching. He couldn't take the whispering or the looks when he walked down the hall. His career was destroyed because Justin McTeague cried wolf.'
notes: Justin McTeague fabricated abuse claim after Sammers reported him for smoking weed. Justin later truthfully accused Dr. Keppler. Sammers proved innocence with ATM receipt but workplace exposure (SVU questioned colleagues/principal who said he was 'pervy') destroyed his teaching career. 18-hour interrogation but no arrest/charges. Career-ending harm qualifies as severity 3.

quote_or_scene: Clive arrested in front of his son Jeffrey: 'Jeff: Please don't take my dad to jail. Please don't take my dad to jail.' ADA Alex: 'We have Clive Lynwood's DNA, and he's walking out of here.' Judge dismisses charges due to partial DNA match (5.5 markers instead of 13): 'Ms. Scarry: That of the dozen or so men in this room it is just as possible that he murdered Dr. Keppler... Judge: I'm throwing it out... I'm dismissing the charges.'
notes: Partial DNA match (his son Jeffrey shares half his DNA) led to wrongful arrest. Arrested in home in front of his developmentally disabled son who witnessed his father taken away. Charges dismissed when defense expert proved partial DNA match unreliable. Severity 3: arrest plus family trauma.

police_conduct_quote: Detective: 'You don't want to show us your ear? We'll take it downtown.'
quote_or_scene: Detectives confront Efraim at the dance club in front of other customers. Benson: 'Tisa, right?' Efraim: 'Yeah. She's my girlfriend.' Benson: 'So I guess you're not going to dance with me, then.' Stabler: 'Police. Turn your head around.' Efraim resists showing ear. Detective threatens: 'You don't want to show us your ear? We'll take it downtown.' Later cleared: 'Wrong guy. He finally let us take an ear print. Didn't match.'
notes: Efraim was publicly confronted at the dance club where he was a customer. He was obsessed with Tisa and knew details about her life and boyfriend. Detectives physically approached him, identified themselves as police in a public setting, and coerced him to show his ear for comparison to crime scene evidence. He was later cleared when his ear print did not match. While the confrontation was public (at the club), there's no evidence of consequences beyond the immediate police interaction, and exposure appears limited to police contact. Severity 1 because while public setting, no formal sanction or lasting harm shown.

police_conduct_quote: Detective Fin Tutuola confronts Elijah aggressively: 'You were murdering people at her age. So what?' 'They make you rape, too? Because I know the LRA uses rape as a weapon.' Detective pressures him during interrogation about his past as child soldier.
quote_or_scene: Elijah is arrested and interrogated about Miriam's assault. He confesses he went to kill 'the Devil' (Serumaga) at Miriam's request but denies hurting her. Later proven innocent when real perpetrator (Serumaga) is identified and arrested. Elijah states: 'I went to take a life. Not Miriam's... I don't know his name. Miriam just calls him the Devil.'
notes: Elijah was wrongly suspected based on circumstantial evidence (his past as child soldier, being with Miriam before attack, fleeing when police arrived, gasoline smell on clothes). He was arrested, interrogated aggressively about his violent past, and confessed to planning to kill Serumaga at Miriam's request - but was innocent of attacking Miriam. The exposure remained police-only (no public confrontation at work/family/media). However, he suffered arrest and harsh interrogation. Later faces deportation (separate legal issue from the false accusation). His ultimate death during standoff is a consequence of the deportation order, not the false murder accusation, so severity rating reflects the arrest/interrogation harm from the false accusation specifically.

police_conduct_quote: Raw's what happens in lockdown when the lights go out... never fight back when they come for you... you better get used to this position, 'cause they like to come back, over and over again. [Physical restraint and intimidation described] / Stabler physically restrains him in threatening position simulating prison rape
quote_or_scene: STABLER: 'Raw's what happens in lockdown when the lights go out.' STEFAN: 'Shut up. Just leave me alone.' STABLER: 'Don't say that. And never fight back when they come for you. That's exactly how it happens.' STEFAN: 'Let go of me.' STABLER: 'You'll never know what hit you. But you better get used to this position, 'cause they like to come back, over and over again.' STEFAN: 'Get off me!' [Vomits] / Later confesses to burglary where 'old man fought him, he hit him back, victim died of heart attack' / Another murder occurs while Stefan in custody, proving innocence
notes: Stefan Henriques was identified by witness sketch, arrested by mob violence, then subjected to extremely coercive interrogation including simulated prison rape threat and physical intimidation by Stabler. He 'confessed' under this duress but only to an unrelated burglary manslaughter. A new murder while he was in custody proved his complete innocence of the serial killings. His exposure was contained to police custody with no public exposure to workplace/family/media. However, the severity of the coercive interrogation tactics and his self-harm attempt (cutting himself with hidden tools to avoid prison) qualify as serious harm. Excluded from person_rows because exposure_channel is police_only and no public exposure occurred - harm was entirely within custody context.

quote_or_scene: Detectives pursue 'Maria' based on Ashlee's fabricated story. They question a woman with a doll in the park: 'Maria. Hold it... Arresting your ass.' Woman protests: 'I don't kidnap nobody!' They chase multiple Marias, confronting one at her workplace. All Marias are cleared when security footage shows Ashlee herself bought the shovel.
notes: Multiple women named Maria were pursued and publicly confronted based on Ashlee's invented kidnapping story. While none suffered major documented harm, they were publicly accused and questioned by police. The primary Maria at the park had a mental health issue (carrying a doll as her 'son') and was arrested before being cleared.

police_conduct_quote: Stabler: 'You murdered your baby and you stuffed her body in your trunk.' Benson: 'We will find where you put her.' Cabot tricks her: 'If my mom had've found out... You were only thinking of yourself... You were afraid you would be blamed.' Ashlee: 'I must have hit her so hard, I killed my baby.' Cabot: 'No, you didn't... Sierra died from measles.'
quote_or_scene: Ashlee is arrested for murder based on circumstantial evidence (shovel purchase, car smell). Press conference shows reporters asking: 'Was that shovel used for the crime? Is Sierra Walker dead?' Attorney Sophie Devere defends her publicly. In interrogation, detectives accuse her of murder repeatedly. ADA Cabot extracts false confession by implying leniency, then reveals Sierra died of measles, not violence. Ashlee's life is destroyed—publicly branded a child killer, then revealed to be guilty only of negligent burial after natural death.
notes: Ashlee is partially involved (she did bury Sierra and steal a credit card), but she is innocent of MURDER—the crime she was publicly accused of, arrested for, and coerced into confessing to. Sierra died of measles, not from being spanked. Ashlee's false confession to killing Sierra via spanking was obtained through psychological manipulation. Her reputation is destroyed; her mother Ruth turns against her. Severity 4 due to suicide attempt implied in final scene and life-altering public humiliation as accused child-killer.

police_conduct_quote: Stabler uses pressure tactics: 'I understand if you couldn't take it anymore and you hit her.' Bill responds emotionally: 'Stop it! That's not who I am... What kind of a father am I?'
quote_or_scene: Stabler: 'What I'm saying is, I've got teenage daughters, too. And I know how they can push your buttons. Stay out late, date guys you don't like... I understand if you couldn't take it anymore and you hit her.' Bill: 'Stop it! I'm sorry. That's not who I am... I didn't touch her. I swear I didn't. I will take a lie detector test. Anything.'
notes: Bill Garnet accused in front of wife during hospital interview. Detectives use coercive interrogation tactics exploiting his unemployment stress. He's cleared quickly but subjected to emotional manipulation. Wife present during accusation adds family exposure element.

police_conduct_quote: Tutuola: 'Were your broken ribs and dislocated shoulder accidents, too?' implying Ethan caused injuries. Steve Walker yells at station: 'You beat her up!' Ethan: 'Saved her from you, drama queen.' Steve: 'You're dead now, ass wipe.'
quote_or_scene: Detectives question Ethan at school (Grandview Prep) about Kim. Later bring him to precinct where his mother is present. Steve Walker physically attacks Ethan at station: 'What did you do to Kim?' Ethan: 'Saved her from you, drama queen.' Steve: 'You beat her up!' Multiple confrontations in public/semi-public settings.
tags: red_herring; school_questioned; public_confrontation; teen; assaulted; family_present
notes: Ethan questioned at school (drama program), then brought to precinct with mother present. Physical altercation with Steve Walker at station with multiple witnesses (detectives, parents). Prior school record of fighting used against him (obtained illegally via security contact). Cleared when Kim reveals Steve was actual abuser. Suffered reputation damage and physical assault as consequence of false accusation.

quote_or_scene: Judge Marsden to undercover detective Sirota: 'You can always show your appreciation with a donation to my reelection campaign.' In court, Marsden upgrades charges: 'I'm amending the complaint to Grand Larceny Auto, Custodial Interference, and Endangering the Welfare of a Child... I'm remanding your client to jail until trial.' Defense attorney: 'You can't do this.' Marsden arrested moments later.
notes: Pauly committed joyriding but charges maliciously upgraded by corrupt Judge Marsden as part of kickback scheme with Wellsburg facility. Father (undercover detective) paid bribe to have Pauly sent away. Marsden amended charges from joyriding to Grand Larceny Auto + child endangerment and remanded him to jail. Innocent of the UPGRADED charges; guilty of original joyriding. Included because he represents pattern of Judge Marsden's scheme victimizing minors with false/inflated charges. Charges dropped when Marsden arrested.

police_conduct_quote: For a rapist? Occupational hazard.
quote_or_scene: Owen admits he raped Pam but claims: 'She wanted me to. Look in my pants. In the pocket. I met her on a fantasy rape site. She sent me detailed instructions. When, where, exactly what she wanted me to do to her. She wanted me to rape her!' Investigation reveals Tyler Brunson fabricated the fantasy rape communications to set Owen up.
notes: Owen committed rape but was deceived into believing Pam consented through elaborate scheme by Tyler Brunson. He is innocent of knowingly raping an unwilling victim, but guilty of the act itself. His belief he had consent was manufactured through Tyler's manipulation. The detectives mock him ('occupational hazard') despite the complex circumstances. He was arrested and charged. Classified as 'partially_involved' because he committed the physical act but was manipulated regarding consent.

quote_or_scene: Harrison is arrested for Rachel Nauss's murder based on blood evidence. Case dismissed due to contamination concerns. Later hunted as suspect in Annie May Lawson murder at Coney Island based on 'his exact MO' and fabricated thumbprint evidence planted by Stuckey. Transcript reveals Stuckey killed Lawson and framed Harrison: 'I killed O'Halloran, too' / 'after Donnelly cut Harrison loose, that was all you' / 'I put the thumbprint on the soda can to get Harrison.'
tags: mentally_ill; arrested; charged_then_dropped; perp_walk; media_outing; fabricated_claim; wrong_ID; manhunt
notes: Harrison IS mentally ill, dangerous, and did attack his attorney Zimmer (though she survived initially). However, he is INNOCENT of: (1) Rachel Nauss murder (first victim - actual killer unknown/not revealed), (2) Annie May Lawson murder at Coney Island (killed by Stuckey who planted Harrison's thumbprint), (3) Julia Zimmer's car bomb death (rigged by Stuckey), (4) attempted murder of Judge Donnelly (potassium chloride attack by Stuckey). Harrison suffered massive public exposure through arrest, perp walk, media coverage, citywide manhunt for murders he didn't commit. Tagged as 'partially_involved' because he did commit violence against Zimmer (non-lethal assault), but was innocent of the specific murders attributed to him that drove the public exposure and manhunt.

quote_or_scene: Stabler to Tate: 'I made a mistake, victor. I wanted to tell you myself. We arrested katie harris' rapist today... You'll be a free man soon.' Later, Tate responds: 'I told you I didn't! Many times ago! And then my life just stopped! Lost my woman, my friends! Hell, my mother barely knows me!'
notes: Victor Tate was wrongfully convicted 10 years ago for the rape of Katie Harris. The real rapist, Mark Foster, confessed, but his death made the confession inadmissible in court. Tate lost his partner, friends, and relationship with his mother during his wrongful imprisonment. Despite proven innocence, he cannot be released and must serve the remaining 15 years of his sentence. Stabler apologizes formally on-screen. This represents catastrophic harm - a decade of wrongful imprisonment with no remedy.

police_conduct_quote: You heartless son of a bitch. Already scrubbed her out of your life. Probably chucked her dog overboard too.
quote_or_scene: Detectives board Owen's boat, he runs, they shoot flare gun and arrest him. 'You're just the loving boyfriend who suddenly takes up running as soon as the cops arrive?' He's accused of murder before they discover kilos of cocaine on board. Later proven he was sailing back from Tampa when Emily was killed.
notes: Owen is arrested for Emily's murder and accused of killing her to prevent her from interfering with his drug dealing lifestyle. He's later cleared when his alibi (yacht club in Cape May) checks out and it's established Emily wasn't even living with him. The arrest and accusation happened on his boat with no public audience beyond the detectives, so exposure was police_only. However, he was arrested and faced the legal consequence before being cleared.

police_conduct_quote: Listen, you murdered one of yours. Oh, oh, I'm sorry. That's right. You called Emily your girlfriend.
quote_or_scene: Detectives arrest Vance in his office during a company basketball game with employees watching. 'Drop the ball. Put your hands behind your back.' He's arrested in front of his entire staff for Emily's murder. ADA Paxton later confronts him in his office, threatening him publicly. He's charged and arraigned but later proven innocent when his daughter Chantel is revealed as the actual killer.
notes: Vance is publicly arrested in his workplace in front of all his employees during a company event. He's charged with murder, arraigned, and held on $1 million bail. Though he confesses to protect his daughter, he did not commit the murder - Chantel did. The public arrest at his tech company in front of his staff represents significant workplace exposure and reputational harm, even though he willingly took the blame. He faces legal consequences (arrest, charges, bail) before the truth emerges.

police_conduct_quote: Detective Stabler to Donovan during interrogation: 'All those years without a woman. You're a pro at fantasy. You get tired of just thinking about it, so you go up there and you do all the things that you've dreamed up all alone in your cell.' Also: 'Where is she, donovan?' [aggressive interrogation implying he killed/buried victim]
quote_or_scene: Stabler goes to Donovan's workplace pier with multiple officers, publicly questions him in front of coworkers about kidnapping/assault. Donovan's boss says 'I got a crew sitting idle' due to police disruption. Later Stabler says to Donovan on roof: 'Lily lied. Elliot was coming to apologize to you. If you'd waited a moment longer, you'd be a free man.' Lily admits: 'I was abducted. No, you weren't. You were not assaulted. You weren't kidnapped or tossed into the river.'
tags: wrong_ID; fabricated_claim; public_confrontation; ruined_at_work; perp_walk; ex_con; preexisting_complaint; coerced_confession_attempt; partial_apology
notes: Donovan had preexisting complaints from Lily about peeping/smoking/threats that police investigated before the kidnapping accusation. When Lily disappeared, boyfriend Parker and Lily herself (after being found) initially identified Donovan as attacker. Detectives publicly confronted Donovan at his workplace dock in front of coworkers and boss, disrupting business operations. He was arrested, interrogated aggressively with implications he murdered victim, and subjected to perp walk. Lily later confessed she fabricated entire crime to hide meth addiction from boyfriend - she trashed her own apartment and jumped in river herself. Stabler attempted to apologize but Donovan threw him off roof before apology could be delivered (leading to separate attempted murder charge). ADA Paxton initially resisted dropping charges even after truth emerged. Severity 3: arrest, public workplace exposure, interrogation, but ultimately cleared before trial on sex crime charges.

police_conduct_quote: Detective threatens: 'You're hurting me. Let go of me!' Coach: 'You're hurting me. Let go of me!' Detective responds: 'Yeah, you'll be saying that a lot in prison.' Later Elliot physically attacks him during interrogation, choking him until he can't breathe.
quote_or_scene: Detectives arrest coach publicly during wrestling practice. Detective Stabler blows whistle, tells students to run laps, then arrests coach in front of them: 'Mr. Simons... For starters, you can step away from the boy... Cory banks. He tells us that he's learned a lot of moves from you... We were just wondering where he learned about naked wrestling.' Coach arrested and taken to precinct. During interrogation, Stabler becomes physically violent: 'You tear that boy up... You're gonna tell me about it.' Coach gags: 'I can't breathe!' Fin: 'Elliot!' Later confirmed innocent: 'Lots of backrubs to the team. No molesting... We're extraditing him to baltimore for failing to register as a sex offender.'
tags: public_confrontation; arrested; wrong_ID; coach; school_alert; interrogation_coercion
notes: Coach Acardo is a registered sex offender from a prior Maryland conviction (real perp in that case), but he is INNOCENT of molesting Cory Banks specifically—the accusation that brings SVU to him. The actual abuser is Cory's stepfather Thomas Banks. Coach gave sports massages that made Cory uncomfortable but did not molest him. He is publicly arrested at the school wrestling practice in front of students, causing workplace exposure and reputational harm. During interrogation, Stabler physically assaults him (choking). Medical tests prove he is clean (no chlamydia), exonerating him of the Cory accusation. He receives no apology and is extradited on a separate registry violation charge.

police_conduct_quote: STABLER: 'You're under arrest.' BENSON: 'Were you afraid A.J. was gonna tell Mom that Daddy was being naughty with her?' STABLER: 'She bit you. Your blood was in her mouth.'
quote_or_scene: GREG: 'I didn't kill my daughter! I loved her!' STABLER: 'You loved her? All right. But her bedroom got boring, so you took her to that sleazy motel?' GREG: 'You don't know what the hell you're talking about. [...] Martin Gold was a lying prick. [...] Not after he convinced my daughter that she had repressed memories of me molesting her.' [...] Police arrest him at home: 'You're under arrest.' GREG: 'For what, bleeding?' STABLER: 'No, for raping and murdering your daughter.'
tags: fabricated_claim; public_confrontation; arrested; family_destroyed; therapist_manipulation; repressed_memory_hoax
notes: Greg Dunne was falsely accused by his daughter A.J. of childhood molestation based on 'repressed memories' planted by therapist Martin Gold. He confronted Gold physically (arrested 10:30-10:45am with documented alibi for murder timeframe). Police arrested him at home in front of his wife for rape/murder of A.J. His wife witnessed the arrest and heard the rape accusation. He was cleared when his jail alibi was verified. The false molestation accusation destroyed his relationship with his daughter before her death. Severity 3: arrested on false charges, publicly humiliated at home, family relationships destroyed.

police_conduct_quote: STABLER: 'Maybe raping and murdering a kid gave you the runs.' BENSON: 'Looks like she touched you. [...] She bite you when you were strangling her?' STABLER: 'Now you should have seen a doctor. Because there's nothing dirtier than the human mouth.'
quote_or_scene: RICHARD: 'I swear. A guest heard noises. I went up with the passkey, found the girl dead, and called 911.' STABLER: 'An hour later.' RICHARD: 'Well, because I was stuck in the can. [...] I never touched her.' BENSON: 'Looks like she touched you. She bite you when you were strangling her?' RICHARD: '[Exclaiming] It's not a bite. I burned it when I was cooking.' STABLER: 'So, what you cooking, Scratchy? Heroin?' RICHARD: 'So I use. Big deal. [...] She was already dead, so I jacked her phone. [...] But I didn't kill her.'
notes: Richard, the hotel desk clerk and heroin user, was initially suspected because he had a hand injury and delayed calling 911. Police aggressively interrogated him with accusations of rape/murder. He was innocent—he stole A.J.'s phone after finding her dead and took crime scene photos to sell online. No indication the accusation spread beyond police interrogation, so exposure_channel = police_only. Severity 1: private interrogation with threats/insults but no public exposure or formal charges shown.

police_conduct_quote: Detective accuses him of grooming children with lollipops: 'That's what those little girls said when you snatched 'em off the street?' and 'The lollipops, the bike rides, Shrinks call that grooming behavior.' Also: 'Once they're dead, they don't feel nothing, huh?' Aggressive interrogation implying he murdered children.
quote_or_scene: Detectives confront him at Columbia Market, arrest him in front of workplace. During interrogation: 'The lollipops, the bike rides, Shrinks call that grooming behavior. Making children trust you. Is that how you found Magda and Ruby, riding around on your bike job?' He responds 'I don't know who they are.' Later: 'Looks like he'll be cycling off into the sunset' when another body is found while he's in custody.
notes: Delivery boy with intellectual disability who gives lollipops to children. Two callers reported him as suspicious. Arrested at workplace (Columbia Market), bike confiscated, subjected to aggressive interrogation where detectives accuse him of murdering multiple children. Cleared when third victim is killed while he's in custody (6 hours in lock-up). No apology shown. Shows pattern of targeting vulnerable person based on witness tips and behavior SVU interprets as 'grooming.'

police_conduct_quote: Detective to Peter: 'You're every woman's worst nightmare.' 'You enjoy screwing people.' 'You get off on inflicting pain?'
quote_or_scene: Detectives arrest Peter Butler after A.Q. hookup with victim Anna: 'Idiot, you're under arrest for the rape and murder of Anna McWilliams.' Peter: 'I didn't kill that girl. We hooked up, and I split.' Later cleared via DNA: 'Peter Butler didn't rape Rebecca Ellison... And through codis. He's clean.' 'Peter Butler's not your killer.'
notes: Peter Butler is arrested for Anna's murder based on A.Q. hookup app evidence showing he met her in park shortly before murder. He's interrogated aggressively with moral condemnation ('you're every woman's worst nightmare,' 'you enjoy screwing people') but DNA evidence clears him of murder. However, he IS actually guilty of knowingly spreading HIV (different crime). His arrest/interrogation for murder specifically represents false accusation. Exposure limited to police/grandfather present during arrest. No public workplace/media exposure for murder accusation specifically. Later publicly exposed for HIV status via leaked faceunion account (separate incident). Included as proven_innocent for MURDER accusation only.

quote_or_scene: Anne tells detectives: 'I was out shopping the other day, And I had this strange sense That someone was following me.' She describes a man with 'Sunglasses, Dark hair' following her. Later at church: 'Gun! / Oh, my god, Get her out of here! / Please don't let him kill me!' Ramsey is arrested at gunpoint in front of entire congregation. Anne later says to detectives: 'I'm so glad you arrested him. Do you think he killed my parents? / I do.' Anne fabricated the stalker claim and murder accusation to frame Ramsey.
notes: Anne Gillette deliberately fabricated stalking claims against Detective Ramsey to divert suspicion from herself as her parents' actual murderer. She knew he was investigating her embezzlement. The arrest occurred at a church funeral service with congregation present - extremely public humiliation for a fellow officer. Ramsey is revealed to be a detective running off-books investigation into Anne's embezzlement. He is ultimately proven innocent when Anne confesses to killing her parents and attempting to hire hitman to kill Ramsey and Benson. Severity=2 because public arrest at church in front of congregation, though no formal sanction resulted since his police credentials were quickly verified.

quote_or_scene: Detectives burst into his residence while he's with girlfriend Mina. 'You! You! Get away from her! Back off!' Confronted about victim: 'Looks like you went too far with this one.' 'Never seen her.' Accused of painting pentagrams in human blood and writing violent lyrics. Mina present throughout interrogation.
notes: Cleared by alibi - was with band in the Bronx all night. Blood for pentagrams came from girlfriend who stole it from blood bank where she worked. Public accusation in front of girlfriend/artistic collaborator.

police_conduct_quote: Stabler calls her 'Mitch' and 'tough guy' during arrest. When she punches him during arrest at public rally, he says 'That was quick. She didn't punch you again, did she?' treating the assault dismissively.

Let her go!' Later at hospital after real rapist caught, crowd attacks Sharon: 'You are dead, you killed alisa!' Babs Duffy's public speech implies Sharon is the rapist before she's cleared.
