notes: Arrested at public rally in front of media and lesbian community supporters. Called 'Mitch' (her intimate nickname with victim) publicly. Victim's dying word 'Mitch' was actually asking FOR Sharon, not accusing her. Sharon physically attacked by crowd after second rape occurs. Has history of domestic violence but was innocent of murder. Significant reputation damage in close-knit community.

quote_or_scene: Officer Delgado: 'I was doing a walk-around of the building When I saw movement up on that fire escape Outside miss duffy's bedroom... I yelled for the suspect to show his hands. He turned around holding this [tire iron]. I fired one shot, he fell.' Doctor: 'Single G.S.W. To the left buttock, Mild concussion from the fall.' Babs later publicly reveals at rally: 'The man the police caught last night Was not the one who's been terrorizing our community. In fact, he's someone I know, Someone I know well... I'm in a relationship with him.'
notes: Shot by protective detail officer while trying to visit girlfriend Babs Duffy via fire escape (window sticks, she sits out there). Mistaken for the rapist targeting lesbians. Was carrying tire iron to help open stuck window. Sustained gunshot wound to buttock and concussion. Then publicly outed at major rally as Babs' boyfriend, which exposed both of them to community backlash (Babs was closeted bisexual presenting as lesbian leader). Relationship ended due to being shot: 'getting shot kind of soured him on me.'

police_conduct_quote: The urge just never goes away, does it? You see a sweet young thing walking down the street and you just have to have her... So you punish them for being whores... Mike, where's your gun?
quote_or_scene: Detectives storm Gallagher's home while children are present. Wife Sarah says: 'Please don't shoot. Please.' Detectives confront him in front of family: 'Young hookers. You've got a thing for them... Your semen was found inside her.' Wife learns intimate details of his sexual requests and prostitute visits. Later cleared when another prayer card drops while he's in custody.
notes: Gallagher is 'partially_involved' - he did hire a prostitute (Abby Mannion) and had consensual rough sex with her, but he did not rape or murder her or Maggie Ortiz. He is innocent of the murders he was accused of. The exposure occurs dramatically at his home with wife and children present. His wife learns graphic details about his sexual activities and preferences. Another prayer card appearing after his arrest proves his innocence regarding the murders. Severe marital and family consequences result from the public accusation in his home.

quote_or_scene: Kat: 'Paul Davies. The guy who assaulted you?' Lakira: 'She already lied to the court once and had to recant.' Davies: 'After what almost happened to me in court I've been on the straight and narrow. I'm trying to get my family back.' Davies: 'Lakira...She already left you at the altar once.' This establishes Davies was previously accused by Lakira, she recanted in court, and he beat the charges. His wife appears to have kicked him out ('lives in Chelsea now. His wife must've kicked him to the curb'). However, DNA evidence proves he IS guilty of murdering Dakota Knight in this episode.
tags: wrong_ID; witness_recant; perp_walk; media_outing; custody_dispute; later_actually_guilty_different_crime
notes: COMPLEX CASE: Davies was falsely accused by Lakira of rape (she recanted in court, he was acquitted/cleared). This caused public exposure, trial, marital breakdown (wife kicked him out), and reputation harm—all consequences of the FALSE accusation. HOWEVER, in THIS episode's events, he IS guilty of murdering Dakota Knight (DNA evidence confirms). Including him because the transcript establishes prior false accusation with material consequences (severity 3: trial, marriage breakdown, trying to 'get family back'). The false accusation harm is distinct from his actual guilt in the current case. This is a 'partially_involved' situation where he was innocent of the FIRST accusation but guilty of the SECOND crime.

quote_or_scene: Detectives question Jenny about attacking Emily Cutler. She admits throwing a flowerpot but denies murder. DNA swab taken. Later cleared.
notes: Jenny was investigated as a suspect for Emily Cutler's murder based on her history of violent behavior toward Emily (throwing flowerpot). She admitted past obsessive behavior but was ultimately cleared. Exposure remained police-only with no public consequences shown.

quote_or_scene: Claire, now a lawyer, is questioned about dropping a firebomb in the Cutlers' mail slot years ago. She cooperates with DNA swab and is later cleared.
notes: Claire was investigated for Emily's murder due to past violent act (firebomb). She expressed regret and cooperated. DNA cleared her. No public exposure beyond the private interview. Her law firm was not informed.

quote_or_scene: Rita is arrested for Emily's murder after her blood is found on the crime scene mattress. She explains the blood came from consensual sex with Cal during menstruation. Detectives find her diary confessing to wanting Emily dead and confessing to 'killing' Cal, but investigation proves she killed neither person.
notes: Rita was arrested based on DNA evidence (her menstrual blood on the mattress) but was ultimately proven innocent. Her 'confession' to killing Cal referred to emotional guilt for not stopping him from drunk driving, not actual murder. She was cleared of both murders. Arrest constitutes material sanction (severity 3).

quote_or_scene: Detectives interview him about sexual encounter with Jack at wedding. He says 'I got a wife and six kids back in provo' and 'You can't tell hector about this. I run his distribution center in utah. I'm idrina's godfather.' Security tapes show he stayed in room, clearing him of murder.
notes: Man had consensual encounter with adult male hustler Jack (who was 19). Detectives accused him of murder. His role/relationship to bride's family means workplace (Hector's distribution center) exposure. Wife refused to post bail, indicating family consequences. Cleared by security footage showing he remained in room.

police_conduct_quote: Fin asks coworkers 'Which one of you knows this guy intimately. You rolled him right after you had sex with him.' Detective says to Julio: 'You seem a little uncomfortable. What is it--your coworkers don't know?' then 'I'm no maricon' and detective responds about the watch 'What is this? Your boyfriend just give it to you after he stole it off his last trick?'
quote_or_scene: Detective accuses kitchen workers in front of coworkers: 'One of you knows this guy intimately. You rolled him right after you had sex with him.' Julio arrested for stealing watch from corpse, held in jail, threatened with deportation. Detective mocks his sexuality in front of colleagues. DNA and prints clear him of murder.
notes: Guatemalan immigrant accused of sexual relationship with victim and murder in front of all kitchen staff coworkers. Arrested for theft. Threatened with deportation. Mocked about sexuality. DNA/prints cleared him. Actually only took items from corpse (theft), innocent of murder/sexual assault.

quote_or_scene: Mother says: 'Last summer he was accused of raping a girl... Someone called the girl's parents and said that andrew had forced her to have sex against her will.' Mallory Sidwell later comes forward: 'I'm mallory sidwell. They put him in that hospital for raping me... I didn't [accuse him]. Whoever told my parents he raped me lied. Andrew's my boyfriend.' Dr. Stanton admitted she called parents and had Andrew committed to avoid arrest. Episode reveals Stanton was sexually abusing Andrew since age 13 and used false rape accusation to maintain control via hospitalization.
notes: Dr. Stanton fabricated rape accusation against her own patient Andrew (who she was molesting) to get him committed to psychiatric hospital where she could maintain control. Accusation told to victim's parents and Andrew's family. Led to psychiatric commitment, ECT treatment, forced medication. Life-altering harm from false accusation that enabled continued abuse. This is separate from his later (justified) killing of Jack in self-defense.

police_conduct_quote: Being nice to bugs is not a defense for murder. / Well, dogs are easier to control. They come when you call. They give unconditional love. / So maybe laura wanted to end things, and you didn't. And when she wouldn't roll over, you raped and killed her. / All right, let's drop the act, gandhi. You surprised laura and her other man in bed together... So you kicked his ass out, And you took out all your rage on laura.
quote_or_scene: Detectives aggressively interrogate Jan with coercive tactics, accusing him of rape-murder, mocking his vegan/yoga lifestyle ('yogi,' 'gandhi,' 'drawstring pants'), until he invokes right to attorney. He's released after alibi confirmed (neighbor saw him at 10:15 PM during argument about dog poop).
notes: Interrogation stayed private (police station), no public exposure documented. Alibi cleared him. Severity 1 because confined to police interaction with no public exposure or material consequences beyond the interrogation itself.

police_conduct_quote: Yeah, well, you're gonna be walking to a jail cell, jorge. / We got the son of a bitch.
quote_or_scene: Detectives confront Jorge at basketball court in front of coworkers. 'Jorge vargas.' 'You look tired. Why don't you take five?' He's arrested based on DNA planted by his wife (framed). 'Yeah, well, your chile sure was.' Wife admits she was given instructions by mystery woman to frame him. He's released: 'You're free, lover boy.' 'What about my wife?' 'She framed you for murder, jorge.'
notes: Jorge was deliberately framed by his wife working with the real killer. His DNA/semen was planted at crime scene. Accused publicly at workplace (basketball court with coworkers present), arrested, held in jail. Wife arrested for obstruction. Proven innocent when frame-up revealed. Severity 3: arrested and jailed, public workplace accusation.

person_label: John 'Johnny' Reilly (plant foreman, Rosa Doletti's son)
police_conduct_quote: You are going to prison, pal. And there you're gonna be the fresh meat. / Reilly, listen to her. You've ruined that woman's life. Now's your chance to be a man.
quote_or_scene: Reilly arrested for assault on undercover detective. Detectives threaten him with prison rape ('you're gonna be the fresh meat'). His mother Rosa Doletti brought in: 'Tell them the truth, mr. Reilly. Please, if you did something, if you hurt that poor girl, You have to tell them.' Reilly falsely confesses: 'I did it. I killed laura.' Later proven innocent when forensics show killer was right-handed, Reilly is left-handed. He confessed to protect his mother, the actual killer.
notes: Reilly falsely confessed under pressure from detectives and emotional manipulation by his mother's presence. His lawyer repeatedly told him to stop talking. He was at crime scene (DNA in pants) but didn't commit murder. Mother Rosa was actual killer protecting family business. Severity 3: arrested, coerced false confession, threatened with prison rape.

police_conduct_quote: You murdered those two precious angels... You're gonna tell me why you burned up those two innocent children... You were protecting all your girls... Just tell me it was an accident.
quote_or_scene: Frank arrested at crime scene: 'Frank sullivan, you're under arrest for the murders of kedzie sullivan and faye sullivan.' Daughter Emily screams in court: 'Liar! I hate you! I hope you rot in prison!' Frank attempts suicide by cutting wrists in interrogation. ADA Marlowe later apologizes: 'I am so sorry.'
tags: arrested; charged_then_dropped; perp_walk; public_confrontation; family_alienation; suicide_attempt; coerced_confession_attempt; wrongful_prosecution; imprisoned_pretrial
notes: Frank Sullivan falsely accused of murdering his two daughters via arson for insurance money. Fire marshal's 'junk science' and flawed burn pattern analysis led to arrest. Frank publicly arrested at crime scene, arraigned, held in prison, placed on suicide watch after cutting wrists to prove innocence. His daughter Emily turned against him, screaming 'I hate you' in court. Case dismissed after burn recreation proved electrical short circuit caused fire, not arson. Severity 4 due to suicide attempt, imprisonment, total family destruction, and life-altering accusations of murdering own children.

police_conduct_quote: Detective Stabler sexually arouses suspect during interrogation, getting close and saying: 'The heat, the power. That's your girl. She comes when you call her. You can't do without her... It makes you feel like a man. It turns you on, huh?' After Parisi confesses, ADA Marlowe notes: 'Detective stabler sexually aroused my client to elicit a confession. He was raped at svu.'
quote_or_scene: Stabler uses sexual intimidation tactics in interrogation. Parisi breaks: 'All right, I did it. I set that fire.' ADA Marlowe: 'That's not all it's gonna cost me... the defense now: your honor, detective stabler sexually aroused my client to elicit a confession. He was raped at svu. His confession will be thrown out.' Later: 'Cut pizza face loose.'
notes: Michael Parisi (nicknamed 'Pizza Face') is a registered sex offender with three prior sex abuse arrests who molested Kedzie Sullivan. Detectives believed he set the fire to silence her. Detective Stabler used highly inappropriate sexually-charged interrogation tactics, getting physically close and making sexual comments about fire to arouse/intimidate Parisi into confession. ADA Marlowe explicitly states this amounted to sexual assault during interrogation. Parisi confessed under this coercion but was later released when fire marshal evidence pointed to Frank Sullivan. Confession would have been thrown out. Severity 3: arrested based on coerced false confession obtained through sexual intimidation tactics, though released before formal charges. Exposure remained police-only.

quote_or_scene: GLENN: 'Glenn was arrested back in '98 for domestic battery. False accusation by his ex-wife during a nasty divorce.' LAWYER: 'The judge dismissed the charge.' GLENN: 'So that's on your record, and no adoption agency will touch you.'
notes: Glenn Butler was falsely accused of domestic battery in 1998 by his ex-wife during divorce proceedings. Charge was dismissed by judge, proving innocence. Despite dismissal, arrest record prevents him and current wife Beth from adopting a child through legitimate agencies - forcing them into contact with illegal baby trafficking operation. This is material, lasting harm (severity 3) directly caused by false accusation that remains on record despite exoneration. The accusation was public exposure to family/legal system and has permanent consequences blocking adoption attempts years later.

police_conduct_quote: You abandoned your child... Don't you dare judge me / That's enough... Where is he? Where is my boy? [aggressive interrogation] / You can can-can your ass off, dr. Gerard / She's become psychotic... felony murder. Sophie gerard was as culpable in his death As anyone else.
quote_or_scene: STABLER: 'Where is nicholas?' SOPHIE: 'I don't know.' STABLER: 'Wrong answer... A mother raises her child. Makes him breakfast, takes care of him when he's sick, Tucks him into bed at night.' SOPHIE: 'Don't you dare judge me.' STABLER: 'You abandoned your child.' ... Later: 'It was you.' PAUL: 'You were gonna take him away. You were gonna take him to china. I was not gonna let you have him. I didn't mean for this to happen. The crash was an accident.' Reveals Paul hired Bradman, used credit card in Sophie's name to frame her.
tags: ruined_in_family; arrested; fabricated_claim; custody_dispute; coerced_confession; psychological_breakdown
notes: Sophie is the central innocent victim. Paul framed her by hiring kidnapper Keith Bradman using a credit card in her name. She was publicly accused, aggressively interrogated by detectives who called her an abandoner and pushed her to confess. She suffered catastrophic psychological break (brief reactive psychosis per ME) after son died. No apology given. Police remained hostile throughout, even after son's death, pursuing felony murder charges. Father Paul's confession at end proves her complete innocence. Severity 4: son's death + complete psychological collapse + no remediation.

quote_or_scene: SOPHIE: 'Jason culross.' ... Detectives arrest Culross at his warehouse. STABLER: 'And nicholas olsen, does he have rights? You've been stalking him, recording his every move.' CULROSS: 'His mother hired me to recover him... once I found out that sophie was lying to me About the custody angle [I told her I couldn't help]... I don't know any criminals. She found one on her own.' TSA and air marshal confirm he was in Brazil during kidnapping.
notes: Culross was accused by Sophie of kidnapping Nicholas. Police raided his warehouse, arrested him. He provided alibi (in Brazil, confirmed by TSA and air marshal). He had refused Sophie's job after learning custody was legitimate with father. No public exposure beyond police interaction, but was physically arrested and interrogated. Proven innocent via alibi and explanation of refusing the job.

police_conduct_quote: Would you stop calling me that? I would never hurt a child... / ...perverts like you out there... / He's a manipulator.
quote_or_scene: Grand Central scene: 'You're not going anywhere with my daughter! Let go of my daughter.' ... 'You have the right to remain silent. Anything you say can and will be used against you in a court of law.' Interrogation: Stabler repeatedly calls him a pedophile and manipulator despite Weber's denial and explanation about his sister's suicide.
notes: Erik Weber was arrested at Grand Central Station in front of crowds after Kevin Burton (father) tackled him. Mackenzie initially confirmed he was 'Eddie D' under questioning, then later recanted, revealing the real Eddie D was Wesley (her foster brother, a child). Weber volunteers with children's advocacy groups and explained his sister was raped and committed suicide, which is why he'd never harm a child. Detectives, particularly Stabler, were aggressive and accusatory throughout interrogation, calling him a pedophile and manipulator. No apology shown on screen after he was cleared.

BENSON: 'Yeah, and all the while you're being a perv...Your pretty, pregnant wife is out there Shopping for baby clothes.' STABLER: 'I don't even want to ask if she's expecting a girl.'

You're under arrest.' Wife: 'Edwin!' Later assaulted in custody by Officer McCutcheon. Media perp walk shown. Commits suicide by jumping in front of train after arraignment/bail. Final revelation: BENSON to Weber: 'You hacked his computer And you planted the images of mandy and rose To make it look like he took 'em.' WEBER: 'He did it, olivia. That's why he killed himself.' tags: arrested; perp_walk; media_outing; assaulted; suicide; fabricated_claim; tech_db_error; public_confrontation; ruined_in_family; ruined_at_work
notes: Adelson had prior sex offense convictions (CT 1997, MD 2002) but was innocent of the current charges against Rose and Mandy. Weber, running a vigilante watch group, planted evidence on Adelson's computer via a trojan virus in fake security software. Detectives interrogated Adelson with degrading insults about his pregnant wife. He was arrested at home, assaulted in police custody by Officer McCutcheon, subjected to media perp walk, arraigned publicly, and committed suicide. Wife Louise had no knowledge of his registry status until arrest. Supreme example of consequence_severity 4: death directly caused by false accusation and public exposure.

police_conduct_quote: Detectives follow Harris everywhere, confront him at work presentation ('why did you rape vicki?'), distribute flyers in his neighborhood ('People have a right to know when there's slime stinking up their neighborhood'), taunt him ('You're my bitch now'), and harass him at restaurant before having legal grounds for arrest.
quote_or_scene: Det. Tutuola interrupts Harris's work presentation: 'Why did you rape vicki?' Harris: 'What did you say?' Multiple scenes show detectives following, taunting Harris in bathroom, restaurant, distributing flyers. Benson to Harris: 'You're my bitch now.'
notes: INCLUDED FOR CONTRAST: Harris is ultimately proven guilty via kidnapping charge (duct tape evidence from 1998). However, this row documents that detectives conducted an extensive PUBLIC HARASSMENT CAMPAIGN against Harris BEFORE they had legal grounds to arrest him - after the initial case was dismissed. They deliberately exposed him at work, distributed flyers in his neighborhood, followed and taunted him publicly. This is notable as police misconduct even against a guilty person, and demonstrates the tactics that could devastate an innocent person. The severity rating reflects the material consequences of public exposure and workplace disruption, even though Harris was ultimately guilty.

police_conduct_quote: You're going down for that and murder.

Sassoon: 'That girl in the fountain was already dead when I cut her hair.' Detective: 'Yeah, but not when you raped her. You're going down for that and murder.' Sassoon: 'No, no. I got a lullaby... I was at banana-trama all night.'
notes: Homeless man known for cutting women's hair in the park. Detectives immediately accuse him of rape and murder based on his M.O. and presence in park. His alibi at a nightclub is verified. Interrogation contained threats but no evidence of public exposure beyond the interview room.

police_conduct_quote: Detective: 'You want to do to my partner what you did to that blond girl last night?' Worley: 'What'd she say?' Detective: 'She's not doing too much talking. Being raped and murdered will do that to you.'
quote_or_scene: Detectives arrest Worley based on DNA match. Detective: 'Still have murder.' Worley: 'Not anymore. Emergency vet said this jerk was there till 6:00 a.m. when killer finally coughed up the kotex.' Detective: 'Not fast enough.' Worley: 'I would have enjoyed throwing his sorry ass in jail.'
notes: Wealthy trust fund heir who posted sex videos online. DNA/semen match led to his arrest for rape and murder. Video evidence and veterinary records proved the sex was consensual and he had an alibi for time of death. Was arrested and held, then released. Detectives showed hostility but exposure remained within law enforcement context.

quote_or_scene: At arraignment steps: 'Ms. Von! Can you make a comment? What do you have to say to Lindsay Elding's family?' ADA: 'Why don't you ask the defendant? Hint--it's about water.' Press swarms Prochik who begins ranting about water rights. Prochik falsely confesses in court: 'I put the mushrooms on lindsay elding's salad. I wanted her dead, Because she was trying to corporatize water.' Later reveals: 'I didn't kill her' and 'You saw me on tv. Folks were finally starting to pay attention. So you were willing to go to prison for a soapbox.'
tags: perp_walk; media_outing; public_confrontation; coerced_confession; arrested; charged_then_dropped
notes: Mycology professor and water-rights activist. Accused of murder based on mushroom expertise and confrontation with victim. ADA deliberately exposed him to media on courthouse steps. He falsely confessed to murder in open court to gain platform for his cause and to protect Emma Brooks, whom he loved. Faced full public trial, media coverage calling him a murderer, and was willing to accept life sentence. Though he voluntarily confessed, this was done to protect the actual killer and gain attention for his activism--a complex motivation showing both agency and coercion by circumstance. His reputation was destroyed publicly despite innocence.

quote_or_scene: Detectives question Ash at his workplace about being on Caitlin's 'lay list' and attending the party where she was assaulted. Ash states: 'I didn't even know caitlin was at the party until danny told me. I was too busy taking photos.' He provides photo timestamps as alibi.
notes: Briefly suspected due to presence at party and connection to victim via published 'lay list.' Cleared by timestamped photos proving he was elsewhere during assault.

police_conduct_quote: Detective reads humiliating excerpt from lay list: 'Too bad he shoots with a very short lens.' Ryan responds: 'That bitch is a liar... I'm sorry. I didn't mean bitch, okay?'
quote_or_scene: Ryan is questioned about Caitlin's list and the party. He denies involvement and provides photo evidence with timestamps. 'I didn't even know caitlin was at the party Until danny told me. I was too busy taking photos.'
notes: Suspected due to humiliating description in Caitlin's published 'lay list' and presence at party. Cleared by timestamped photos.

police_conduct_quote: Detective: 'That makes you the biggest idiot in the world. If you do know, it makes you an accomplice. So which one are you?'
quote_or_scene: O'Doole is initially suspected of rape when detectives learn forensic evidence points to paramedics. Detectives confront him at the firehouse in front of colleagues: 'These are calls o'doole and tinta responded to...' O'Doole is accused of theft and covering for Tinta's rapes. He admits: 'Maybe I took a few things I shouldn't have... I don't know what tinta's doing back there.' Later proven innocent of rape; Tinta was the rapist.
notes: O'Doole is publicly confronted at the firehouse by detectives in front of colleagues about rape suspicion. Though guilty of theft and complicity, he is innocent of the rape itself—his partner Tinta committed it. The public workplace confrontation about rape constitutes exposure and harm even though he's guilty of other crimes.

quote_or_scene: UNDERWOOD: 'Ever since they accused me of raping that girl... [after being beaten by Balogh] it's always this way.' In 1996 he was charged with kidnapping Larissa and rape/child pornography but jury acquitted him. TRANSCRIPT: 'Ten-year-old larissa says he was the man Who raped her on film... Lack of physical evidence led the jury to acquit underwood On all charges.' Later detective says: 'After the brandy trial, underwood became a lawyer, Fighting for the rights of the unjustly accused.' He tells taxi after release: 'Didn't I tell ya I'd be walking out a free man?'
notes: INCLUDED FOR CONTRAST/CONTEXT: This person was ACTUALLY GUILTY but acquitted due to evidentiary issues (lack of physical evidence, victim never saw face). The episode explicitly frames his post-acquittal life as someone 'falsely accused' who faced severe consequences (beaten during home invasion, became civil rights attorney defending 'unjustly accused'). He weaponizes his acquittal throughout episode. His case demonstrates how actual perpetrators can exploit wrongful accusation narratives. Severity=4 due to life-altering vigilante violence (beaten nearly to death by Balogh) and permanent reputational impact despite his actual guilt being revealed by episode end.

police_conduct_quote: STABLER: 'Did you rape your daughter? Did you rape your daughter back in falmouth? Did you rape your own daughter?' JACKSON: 'I can't remember! But...I think I... I think I did. Oh, God. I think I did.'
quote_or_scene: LINDA: 'Ann and I were skinny-dipping and you came down... You stripped and jumped in... Ann got upset and... She went back up to the house... Yes, but I stayed and... You came after me and there was no stopping you and...' STABLER: 'Hold on. You and Jackson? Not Ann?' LINDA: 'Ann? Oh, no! No. It was cap and me... I was 17 and I don't regret it.' Later: 'I was Ann's first love. We broke her heart that night.'
notes: Cap Jackson is accused (primarily by detective pressure and his own recovered 'memories') of raping his daughter Ann 20 years ago. He publicly confesses this belief to detectives and later to his therapy group at his clinic, causing his patients to abandon him. Linda later reveals Cap had consensual (though drunk) sex with her, not Ann. Ann's estrangement was due to heartbreak over Cap sleeping with her first love, not sexual assault. Cap suffered 20 years of guilt, estrangement from his daughter, and professional ruin (clinic emptied) based on a false memory. The detectives' aggressive interrogation ('Did you rape your daughter?') repeatedly pushed him toward confession. His 'confession' was public in that it occurred in front of his therapy group, destroying his credibility and causing all patients to leave his practice.

police_conduct_quote: I find out you ordered the hit, I will end you. / Send a hitter my way, He's going straight to the morgue.
quote_or_scene: Rivera confronted in prison about Page Ferguson's murder. Olivia threatens: 'I find out you ordered the hit, I will end you.' Rivera responds with counter-threat. His lawyer ends interview. Later proven he was at Rikers without phone access and couldn't have ordered hit.
notes: Rivera was immediately suspected because he threatened Page Ferguson in open court and had motive (upcoming trial). However, phone logs prove he had no access to make calls from Rikers. Exposure remained at police/legal level with no public exposure or material consequences beyond the interrogation itself.

police_conduct_quote: You had your informant kill a d.A. For drug money. Damon was your weakest link, so he had to go. / You had sex with her and you abused her, I wouldn't call that love.
quote_or_scene: Riggs interrogated about Page's murder. Accused of: 'You had your informant kill a d.A. For drug money.' And 'You had sex with her and you abused her.' Riggs denies abuse, explains Page self-harmed, provides ER records showing police had previously investigated domestic violence claims but he was not arrested.
notes: Riggs was Page Ferguson's secret boyfriend for nearly a year. He was accused of domestic violence and orchestrating her murder through his informant. He explains Page's injuries were self-inflicted (cutting disorder). ER records and prior police reports support his version. Interrogation remained private with no public exposure.

person_label: Unnamed male passenger on Paris-bound flight
quote_or_scene: Opening scene on plane: Girl screams 'Stop! What is wrong with you? Get her off of me!' Flight attendant: 'The kid says that this pervert tried to rape her.' Detective responds: 'Turns out the schlub never touched her.' Girl 'freaked out when she woke up and saw him reaching over her' — he was just closing the window shade.
notes: Clear case of mistaken identity. Girl was traumatized from actual rape two days prior at Hayes's party and misidentified innocent passenger. Public accusation in front of other passengers/crew. No indication of apology to the man.

police_conduct_quote: Carl, where you going... back to school? / I didn't do anything. [Detectives pursue and arrest him publicly] / Wasn't enough just to rape her? You had to broadcast it to all your friends? / You're crazy. [Detective responds] I'm still crazy? And you're busted.
quote_or_scene: Detectives confront Carl Cooper outside his apartment building, publicly chase him down, arrest him, and interrogate him about rape and kidnapping. Carl: 'I didn't do anything.' Detective: 'Wasn't enough just to rape her? You had to broadcast it to all your friends?' Carl: 'You're crazy.' Detective: 'I'm still crazy? And you're busted.'
notes: Carl Cooper was expelled from Westmore University for prior sexual assault allegations. SVU targets him based on his matching Phi Delta fraternity tattoo visible in the staged rape video. He is publicly arrested outside his building and accused of rape and kidnapping despite having an alibi (at home with friends, confirmed by landlord). Held on Adderall possession charges but ultimately cleared of the rape/kidnapping. No apology shown.

quote_or_scene: LASKIE: 'Custody began the moment police came to my job and made a show of taking me in.' / 'My ex-wife saw the one that aired. I've got a 12-year-old daughter. Until this gets cleared up, my visitation rights are suspended.' / Raw footage shows Laskie trying to help girl, telling her to call police, but aired version was doctored to make him look predatory.
tags: ruined_at_work; ruined_in_family; public_confrontation; fabricated_claim; custody_dispute; wrongful_arrest
notes: IT engineer caught in TV sting operation. Prosecutors dropped charges after reviewing evidence. TV show 'Neighborhood Predator' doctored footage to make his helpful actions appear predatory. He had gone to police first with chat logs to report endangered minor but was dismissed as 'kook.' When he went to help the girl himself, he walked into a sting. Public arrest at workplace, lost custody/visitation rights with 12-year-old daughter. Filing civil suit against NYPD and network. Producer Donny Spencer admitted to altering footage at Alicia Harding's request. Laskie's arrest was voided but damage already done.

police_conduct_quote: "So Picasso, when was the last time you saw Ellen Sazelin?" / "Really? 'Cause we heard you like to meet the neighbors. Sure you didn't pop upstairs with a bottle of vino? Hey invite yourself in, rape Ellen to inspire your, uh, mojo?"
quote_or_scene: Detectives confront Andreas at his gallery opening with girlfriend/model Cindi present. 'Really? Cause we heard you like to meet the neighbors. Sure you didn't pop upstairs with a bottle of vino? Hey invite yourself in, rape Ellen to inspire your, uh, mojo?' Andreas is proven innocent via timestamped online interview with Michael Spero blog showing he was being interviewed during murder timeframe.
notes: Andreas accused by tenant Maureen of prior assault attempt. Detectives publicly confront him at gallery during opening with girlfriend present, using degrading language ('Picasso,' mocking his 'mojo'). Alibi proven via timestamped video interview. Severity 2: public accusation in front of girlfriend/gallery attendees, though no formal sanction follows.

quote_or_scene: Detectives pursue Aldo as 'the night stalker' because he's wearing bloody clothes. He's arrested on the street after fleeing. Later he explains: 'I did see this man Monday night... I was out walking when I heard a commotion in the alley... the guy come around the corner, covered in blood, and he run right into me.' Dr. Huang confirms Aldo has fatal familial insomnia, explaining his erratic behavior. No apology is offered for the arrest.
notes: Aldo is arrested based on having victim's blood on clothing and reputation as 'neighborhood weirdo.' His innocence is proven when he explains he encountered the victim AFTER the attack and provides location details leading to the actual crime scene. The arrest itself is the primary harm (severity 2: formal police action). No public exposure beyond the arrest scene. Dr. Huang arranges hospital admission for his fatal medical condition rather than booking him.

police_conduct_quote: Stabler to Doug during interrogation: 'You leave it stuck in Jerry Bullard's crotch?' and later aggressive questioning about the scrape on his face suggesting it came from 'attacking Jerry Bullard.'
quote_or_scene: Doug is arrested at The Swing Set for confronting Cassandra and Elliot (undercover). Stabler says: 'You leave it stuck in Jerry Bullard's crotch?' Doug responds: 'I didn't stab anybody.' He's held for interrogation. When ADA Hardwicke says 'Wife confesses, dirtbag walks,' Doug is released. Stabler warns him to stay away from Cassandra, but Doug taunts: 'Right back at ya, officer.' No apology is given. Doug is later murdered by Jerry Bullard in revenge.
notes: Doug is arrested and interrogated as primary suspect for stabbing Jerry Bullard due to: (1) prior confrontation at The Swing Set where he threatened Jerry, (2) fresh scrape on his face, (3) purchasing a new knife after 'losing' his old one. He's held in interrogation with aggressive questioning and verbal threats from Stabler. Jane Bullard's confession proves Doug innocent. He's released with no apology. Severity is 2 (arrest and interrogation without public exposure). However, Doug is later MURDERED by Jerry Bullard after detectives reveal to Jerry that Doug and Cassandra are incestuous twins running a con. This murder is a CONSEQUENCE of the investigation revealing Doug's relationship with Cassandra, though not directly of the false assault accusation. The murder elevates real harm but occurs in a different causal chain.

quote_or_scene: Catherine to detectives: 'Kevin. Isabelle's older brother.' Later: 'Kevin's always on the fire escape, hanging out. I've caught him watching me through the window.' Isabelle confronts Catherine in apartment: 'She's accusing my brother... Kevin said he didn't even touch you.' Detectives question Kevin, pursue him to roof where he attempts suicide. Later exonerated when forensic evidence points to school cafeteria worker.
tags: wrong_ID; ruined_in_family; public_confrontation; mentally_ill; prior_wrongful_SO_registration; suicide_attempt
notes: Kevin Wright is a mentally ill, agoraphobic man with bipolar disorder who was previously wrongfully registered as a sex offender (photographing bridges, woman happened to be in frame). Catherine accuses him based on seeing him on fire escape. This destroys his relationship with his sister Isabelle (Catherine's roommate/best friend). During police pursuit, Kevin attempts suicide by jumping from roof. He is hospitalized/sedated. Later cleared when forensic evidence (cafeteria cleaning agent on shoe print) points to school employee. His prior sex offender registration itself was wrongful (separate incident, 2008). Severity 3: suicide attempt + family rupture + involuntary psychiatric commitment.

police_conduct_quote: Detective to Dwight: 'You always call strangers effin' bitches? You were calling her names in her school parking lot. Then you stalked her, then you raped her. Look, we got evidence putting you in her room.'
quote_or_scene: Dwight arrested at his mother's home in front of her. Tried in open court. Cross-examination reveals Catherine's grandfather (Grant Harrison) and KKK members gang-raped Dwight's mother Lorna in 1964 when Dwight (age 6) was forced to watch at gunpoint. Grant publicly calls Lorna 'dirty whore' and 'pervert' in courtroom. Dwight initially agrees to plea deal, then recants on stand: 'I did not rape Catherine Harrison... I couldn't bring myself to do that. It's not who I am.' Proven innocent: he broke in, assaulted her (climbed on bed, ripped clothes) but did NOT rape her. Catherine later admits grandfather coached her to falsely claim rape.
tags: wrong_ID; fabricated_claim; perp_walk; media_outing; public_trial; ruined_in_family; coerced_plea_attempt; family_trauma_exposed
notes: Dwight Talcott is a recovering addict with burglary record but NO sexual offense history. Arrested for rape based on Catherine's ID and circumstantial evidence. Endures public trial where his attorney (also his cousin) exposes his mother's 1964 gang rape by Catherine's grandfather and KKK members—trauma Dwight witnessed at age 6. Grandfather publicly attacks Dwight's mother in courtroom ('dirty whore with a pervert for a son'). Dwight pressured to plead guilty to rape (25 to life) to spare his mother from testifying, but refuses on stand, telling truth: he broke in seeking revenge but could NOT bring himself to rape Catherine. Catherine later admits she lied about rape on grandfather's coaching. Dwight guilty of breaking/entering and assault, innocent of rape. Severity 4: life-altering—public trial, family's deepest trauma weaponized in court, forced to relive witnessing mother's rape, facing life sentence for crime he didn't commit. Mother's rape became public record.

police_conduct_quote: You snuck into dede's last night, you stole her baby, and you left him outside to freeze to death.
quote_or_scene: Wade is confronted by detectives Stabler and Benson after forensic evidence (red hair, blue eyes) links him to baby Jasper's blanket. He confesses to taking the baby but explains: 'I wasn't trying to kill him! I was trying to save him... I left him outside tumble weeds! People there love kids.' He is arrested for 'endangering the welfare of a child' despite his protective intent. Later proven innocent of intent to harm - he acted to protect the baby from neglect.
notes: Wade is accused of attempted murder/child endangerment. Forensics (hair) lead to his arrest. He confesses to taking the baby but with protective intent, not harmful. He is charged and arrested (makes bail later). The accusation happens in an interrogation room with detectives present. His motive was to save the baby from Ken Turner's neglect. He is later cleared of murderous intent but still faces legal consequences for the kidnapping itself. Includes both arrest and public accusation at precinct.

quote_or_scene: In open court at arraignment, Hunter states: 'I was molested... The creepy guy at the precinct where they took me. Detective Stabler.' Later, Hunter's mother to Stabler: 'I saw your file on lieutenant Tucker's desk. It was pretty thick. How many other guys have you been a little too friendly with?' The allegation is dropped when the plea deal is accepted.
tags: fabricated_claim; public_confrontation; cop; IAB_investigation; coerced_confession; media_exposure; reputation_damage
notes: Hunter Mazelon deliberately fabricated the allegation as retaliation and to manipulate his legal situation. He set up the accusation by yelling 'Don't touch me there, man! I need an adult in here! Quit touching my junk!' during processing, despite Stabler only uncuffing him. Officer Nelson witnessed the scene but could not see Stabler's hands clearly, creating ambiguity. Hunter made the accusation public in open court during arraignment before Judge Ridenour. This triggered an IAB investigation by Lieutenant Tucker, who reviewed Stabler's 'thick file' of prior complaints. The mother weaponized the accusation, suggesting Stabler had a pattern. The accusation was strategic: Hunter's attorney attempted to use it as leverage ('My client would be amenable to dropping his case if you drop yours'). The charge was ultimately dropped when ADA West allowed Hunter to plead out to his original burglary charges, but Stabler endured significant professional scrutiny and career threat during the investigation. Stabler was prohibited from working the case and subject to a restraining order. The public nature of the accusation in court, combined with the IAB investigation, constitutes material harm even though the allegation was eventually dismissed.

police_conduct_quote: You gonna rock her like you did Annette fox? / I still can't believe you're straight. / I'm gonna make sure you don't crawl back into your cracks.
quote_or_scene: Detectives confront Luke at his salon in front of clients: 'You gonna rock her like you did Annette fox?' Client says 'It's not true. It's all a misunderstanding!' Luke arrested at salon. Later proven innocent when ballistics show his gun didn't match and hoodie was different.
notes: Luke is guilty of raping Annette and hiring Eddie to harass her (witness tampering), but he is innocent of murdering Annette. The detectives publicly accused him of murder at his salon in front of clients, arrested him, and subjected him to degrading interrogation. Physical evidence (ballistics, hoodie differences) later proved he did not commit the murder. He was arrested and held, then released when proven innocent of the murder charge specifically. Severity 3 due to public arrest at workplace in front of clients and being held in custody before clearance.

police_conduct_quote: Well, you just lost another one, Diego.
quote_or_scene: Ella: 'He's the one. He had sex with me.' Benson: 'You know, Ella, Mr. Cordova doesn't own a car. He can't drive. So he's not the one, is he?' Ella recants. Detectives questioned Diego at school in front of Monsignor: 'Well, you just lost another one, Diego.'
notes: Diego is a convicted sex offender (statutory rape at age 19) working under his uncle's identity. Ella falsely accuses him after detectives press her. Detectives confront him at school in front of school officials, explicitly telling him he lost his job. He is cleared when Ella's story about him driving her doesn't match facts (he can't drive). No apology shown. Already on sex offender registry from prior statutory case, making this false accusation particularly harmful to his ability to work.

police_conduct_quote: You want to hug your son? And you want to see him grow up? 'Cause you get sent out of state, that's a long trip for your wife and boy to make.
quote_or_scene: Detectives arrest Gabriel in front of his wife and son at the playground. Amaro: 'You don't want to do this here. Just come down to the station with us.' Wife: 'I'm calling my brother.' Gabriel: 'Janey, I don't need a lawyer. I didn't do anything.' Later in custody after suicide attempt: 'You tell my boy I never raped anybody. You tell him that for me.' Final scene: 'It's over, Gabriel. You're free to go home.' Gabriel: 'My... I didn't know that.' [About his twin]
tags: ruined_at_work; ruined_in_family; public_confrontation; arrested; perp_walk; media_outing; suicide_attempt; wrong_ID; db_error
notes: Gabriel is arrested in front of his wife and child at a playground. He is arraigned publicly, remanded to Rikers, and attempts suicide by cutting himself in his cell. His wife believes he's guilty initially. He faces multiple rape charges across states with DNA evidence. Captain mentions 'other states are preparing arrest warrants and extradition requests.' He is held for several days until his identical twin Brian is caught. The DNA match was accurate but belonged to his twin, whom Gabriel didn't know existed. Brian deliberately framed Gabriel by committing rapes in cities where Gabriel lived. Exposure includes: family (wife and son present at arrest), workplace (promotion mentioned, likely employer aware), legal system (public arraignment), and implied media coverage (defense attorney mentions 'public is outraged at your release'). Severity is 4 due to suicide attempt and life-altering consequences including custody concerns and public humiliation.

police_conduct_quote: Michael testifies: 'while one officer held me at gunpoint, the other one pulls this gun out of nowhere and says, "you shouldn't have run."'
quote_or_scene: ARREST SCENE: Detectives chase Michael into Jefferson projects apartment. 'NYPD!' 'Hey! What are you doing?' 'Get down!' 'Get off me!' 'Get off him!' 'What was that? Was that a gun?' 'Leave my boy alone!' 'Don't move!' Mother screaming: 'You can't come up in here!' 'Get out of my house!' 'This is my baby! Don't hurt him!' TRIAL: Defense lawyer Bayard Ellis represents him pro bono. Jury finds him NOT GUILTY on both rape and weapon charges. Mother at verdict: emotional support present. ACQUITTAL strongly suggests innocence - no DNA evidence, questionable gun 'dropsy' case, credible alternative narrative (consensual beer, Sarah invited him in, her one-night stand DNA found on bed from night before).
tags: arrested; public_trial; family_trauma; acquitted; wrong_ID; no_DNA_match; coercive_arrest; bail_posted_then_acquitted
notes: Michael Wedmore is found NOT GUILTY by jury on both rape and gun charges. Evidence supporting innocence: (1) No DNA match to rape - semen found on bed belongs to Sarah's one-night stand from the night before, not Michael; (2) Sarah's credibility undermined - she lied about the one-night stand, invited Michael into apartment, he left peacefully per security footage; (3) Gun evidence questionable - detective admits he didn't actually SEE Michael throw gun, only heard partner yell 'gun' (classic 'dropsy' case per Ellis); (4) Michael's testimony credible - admits being there, having beer, denies rape and gun; (5) Prominent civil rights attorney takes case pro bono, suggesting legitimate civil liberties concerns. Harm: arrested in front of family (mother screaming 'Don't hurt him!'), detained at Rikers until bail posted, endured public trial with family present, subjected to coercive police tactics. Severity 3: material sanction (arrest, detention, trial) with serious family/community fallout, though ultimately acquitted.

quote_or_scene: Captain Lee: 'I just watched you two pinch the naked fish on YouTube. 2,000 hits.' Darren was arrested for public lewdness/masturbation while hallucinating, but reported witnessing a rape (which turned out to be true). Video of his arrest went viral.
notes: Darren was guilty of public lewdness but innocent of lying about the rape he witnessed. He suffered public humiliation via viral video (2,000 YouTube hits) despite being a credible witness. The exposure occurred before his testimony was validated.

police_conduct_quote: Detective to Jay: 'You're a big man, Jay. You put your hands on somebody, it hurts.' 'The only person Gia needs protection from is you.' 'Maybe never [go back to hospital], unless you tell us what you did to Gia.'
quote_or_scene: Jay is a psychiatric patient with PTSD-like symptoms (can't have people behind him, violent reactions). Detectives use his anxiety triggers and threaten to keep him from returning to the hospital unless he confesses. He breaks down: 'I'm sorry! I'm so sorry. I didn't mean it. Please let me go back to the hospital.' He was actually protecting Gia from guard Lee.
notes: Jay is a mentally ill patient who physically confronted Gia (shook her) trying to protect her from guard Lee. Detectives exploited his psychiatric vulnerabilities (positioning behind him to trigger panic) and threatened indefinite detention away from hospital care to extract a confession. He was proven innocent when he named the actual perpetrator (Lee) and explained he was protecting Gia. Severe psychological coercion of vulnerable person.

police_conduct_quote: Detective chases Marc through woods, yells 'Drop it. Don't make me shoot you.' Later interrogates aggressively until Rom Baro intervenes: 'You keep asking questions after his attorney arrives, I'll get it all thrown out.'
quote_or_scene: Neighbor: 'My daughter and her friends are scared of him.' Girls falsely tell detectives Marc had Nico's rabbit's foot. Nadia Grey tries to set Marc on fire: 'He's an animal. He burned my baby.' Marc was 'hustled into handicap van' and hidden in 'backwoods of Jersey' by his community. Rom Baro: 'Marc Rajic has the mental capacity of a child...His tribe is circling.'
tags: wrong_ID; fabricated_claim; ruined_in_family; ruined_physically; public_confrontation; online_rumor; vigilante_attack; coerced_confession
notes: Marc is developmentally disabled ('brain stopped growing before his body did'). Falsely accused by Courtney and Emma who planted evidence (rabbit's foot, Metro card) in his room after sexually assaulting him. His mother hid him in woods. Neighbor's daughter and community were already afraid of him. Nadia Grey attempted to burn him alive with gasoline. Police hunted him aggressively. He was victimized by the actual perpetrators (sexual assault) then framed for murder. Cleared when Emma confesses Courtney killed Nico.

quote_or_scene: AMARO: 'Vicki Harris, you're under arrest for prostitution.' Later explained: 'Look, your daughter's not actually under arrest. That was the only way to get her out of there. She's a victim.'
notes: Vicki is arrested for prostitution as a tactic to remove her from the trafficking situation. She is explicitly described as a victim throughout, not accused of a sex crime as perpetrator. The arrest is later explained as necessary to extract her. Detectives immediately clarify she's not being charged. Including for completeness as she experiences arrest/exposure but is clearly treated as trafficking victim, not perpetrator of sex crime.

quote_or_scene: Judge Crane voluntarily comes to precinct with ex-wife attorney. States: 'Better... an admission. It was me. But it wasn't rape. Meghan wanted it.' Later learns he was tricked by fake emails from Holly: 'Meghan didn't send me these emails? Then I did rape her. God.' Case reveals Holly fabricated profile/emails mimicking his known fetishes from prior Sugar Baby relationship with her.
notes: Judge was deceived into participating in what he believed was consensual role-play fantasy arranged via emails. Holly Schneider (victim's roommate) created fake email account impersonating Meghan, using details from her own prior encounters with the judge to make it believable. Judge publicly admitted to rape before learning of deception. Career/reputation exposed to potential ruin. ADA initially refused to charge anyone until chain of crime proven. Judge ultimately cleared when Holly's scheme revealed.

police_conduct_quote: Detective to Jason: 'Maybe you were staking out the show, figuring when to strike... We know you raped her... Don't even try it.'
quote_or_scene: Detectives set up meeting between Jason and Meghan (who calls him under police instruction). When Jason arrives: 'Jason, you came. You said you needed me.' Jason: 'I shouldn't even be here. The cops came to my apartment. My mom's freaking out.' Meghan confronts him about cameras, then detectives emerge: 'Hey Jason, on your feet. You set me up?' Meghan: 'You spied on me in the shower. What else did you do?' Jason: 'I didn't do anything. I love her.' Arrested in front of Meghan and others present. Later proves innocence via his own surveillance footage showing he was in donkey mask, not goat mask, and someone else committed rape.
notes: Jason installed hidden cameras in Meghan's apartment (unlawful surveillance) but did not commit the rape. Detectives used Meghan to lure him to meeting, then arrested him publicly while accusing him of rape. Mother's distress mentioned ('Mom's freaking out'). Cleared when his own footage proved he attended show in different mask and filmed the actual attack. Still faced charges for surveillance crimes, but rape accusation was false. Detectives used accusatory/threatening language during interrogation.

quote_or_scene: Detectives interrupt Ted's blocking rehearsal in front of cast/crew: 'Your actress gets attacked and you use it in your show?' Benson: 'You're missing your show tonight.' Ted brought to precinct, questioned: 'Somebody impersonating Meghan set her up to be raped... And then they tricked this man, who just so happens to be the judge who presided over your divorce, to actually rape her... Don't you see what this is? This is about me... I am the victim here. I am the one who is being set up.' Detectives inform victim Meghan they think Ted is responsible: 'We think we might have found out who set you up. Your director, Ted.'
notes: Director accused of orchestrating elaborate rape scheme targeting his own actress and a judge who presided over his divorce. Detectives built circumstantial case based on: access to cafe where emails sent, British spelling in his press releases matching fake emails, use of 'Dixie' (his old play title) as safe word, motive against judge, controlling personality. Questioned in front of theater company. Proven innocent when Holly Schneider revealed as actual perpetrator. No apology shown on screen.

quote_or_scene: Detectives question Rob about whether he knew about the abuse and if he had herpes. His father defends him: 'No, that's impossible. My son and Emmy weren't having sex... he's 14 years old. He still has his pokemon cards.'
notes: Rob is investigated as a potential source of Emmy's herpes and as someone who might have known about the incest. He is cleared when it's established he didn't know about the abuse and didn't have herpes. Exposure remained private to police interviews.

police_conduct_quote: Detectives falsely tell her Emmy died: 'Emmy didn't make it... she had a post-op seizure. She's gone.' This is used to pressure her brother Jimmy into confessing.
quote_or_scene: Carmen is questioned about knowing of the incest and helping plan the murders. Detectives: 'Carmen, you love Emmy. And if you could do anything to protect her, you would, wouldn't you?' Carmen: 'That's right. So that's how you know I had nothing to do with her getting shot.'
notes: Carmen was previously accused by Sidney of theft (which was a lie - he pawned the jewelry himself for gambling debts). She is investigated as a possible accomplice in the murders. While she did report the abuse to Joan (who didn't believe her), there's no clear evidence she helped plan the murders, though she may have known about them. She is innocent of the theft accusation but may have had knowledge of the murder plan.

quote_or_scene: SVU raids Murphy's bookie operation. Murphy is arrested but proves he couldn't have killed Sidney: 'Night he died, his team made a miracle comeback in overtime... If he won, he was just gonna lose it back to me again. Sidney was a gift that just kept on giving. Why would I want to kill him?'
notes: Murphy is investigated as a suspect because Sidney Eckhouse owed him gambling debts. He is publicly raided at his bookie operation with multiple associates present. He proves he had no motive to kill Sidney since Sidney was a profitable repeat customer. The arrest was part of SVU's investigation into the murders, though Murphy was ultimately charged with bookmaking and assault on Detective Rollins.

quote_or_scene: During the raid of the social club, McCourt shows detectives Sidney's betting records: 'Find the one marked Crosby, that was Sidney's code name... That's Sidney's. Night he died, his team made a miracle comeback in overtime.' This proves he had no motive.
notes: McCourt is raided along with Murphy as a suspect in the Eckhouse murders due to Sidney's gambling debts. The raid is public with multiple associates present. He immediately provides evidence proving he had no motive to kill Sidney.

quote_or_scene: BAYARD ELLIS: 'Mr. Marsden has a history of contact with the police. He was a suspect in a rape case, jumped bail.' ELLIS: 'He was cleared on all counts. And those charges were the result of a personal vendetta by a now-disgraced police officer.'
notes: Past rape accusation mentioned as part of family court proceeding. Was result of 'personal vendetta by a now-disgraced police officer.' Simon was cleared on all counts. Judge uses this cleared accusation as evidence ('where there's smoke, there's fire') to deny return of his children. The past false accusation continues to harm him in current custody case.

quote_or_scene: MOTHER: 'The police questioned his story... They asked if I ever worried that Leo and her were too close.' MOTHER: 'So you thought your husband, your ex-husband, killed your daughter?' MOTHER: 'She was always a daddy's girl. I thought maybe something happened between them, and he covered it up.' LEO: 'Nobody would believe me. I have nightmares... I lost my marriage, my savings. I spent all my money on a PI, trying to find Celia.'
notes: When daughter Celia disappeared 3 years prior, police questioned whether Leo had inappropriate relationship with her ('too close') and whether he killed her to cover it up. His wife believed police theory, leading to divorce. He spent all savings on private investigator trying to prove innocence by finding Celia. DNA proof that Celia is alive (and was kidnapped as he said) exonerates him 3 years later. Wife acknowledges: 'So all these years I've blamed Leo for something he didn't do?'

police_conduct_quote: I told him that we had all kinds of evidence. I told him that he was going away no matter what. I broke him.
quote_or_scene: Detective Benson: 'I forced a false confession... I broke him.' Judge: 'This court sincerely apologizes and will not allow you to be incarcerated for one minute longer... You're a free man, sir.'
tags: coerced_confession; wrong_ID; witness_recant; imprisoned_8_years; conviction_vacated; DNA_exoneration
notes: Pena was subjected to 9-hour interrogation where Detective Benson used coercive tactics ('I told him we had all kinds of evidence... he was going away no matter what'). She inadvertently fed him false detail about green scarf (actually red) from color-blind officer's evidence log. Victim Ariel Baskins and 6 bar witnesses all misidentified him. He was convicted, sentenced to 315 years, served 8 years. Conviction vacated after DNA from 2013 copycat rape matched true perpetrator (Brazilian sailor Javier) to both crime scenes. Court formally apologized. Detective Benson acknowledged: 'I forced a false confession.' Severity 4: life-altering—8 years wrongful imprisonment.

police_conduct_quote: Did they tell you that you were looking at 25 years to life in prison? It came up.
quote_or_scene: Detectives arrest Kevin at work: 'Police. I'll move the truck. I'm sorry. No, you won't. You're under arrest. Arrest for what? Rape and kidnapping.' Video evidence shows Christine saying 'You're a bad girl... Does your husband know how bad you are? Don't worry about him.' Christine later testifies: 'He's lying. He's making it up.'
tags: fabricated_claim; ruined_at_work; arrested; perp_walk; public_trial; coerced_confession; video_evidence_exonerates
notes: Kevin arrested at workplace in front of coworkers. Faced 25-to-life, coerced into plea deal accepting 6 months for misdemeanor despite video evidence proving consensual relationship. Public trial exposed him. Christine fabricated entire rape claim after consensual 6-month affair. Exley cross: 'You cut a good deal... In exchange for your pornography-fueled fantasy.' Kevin has criminal record (armed robbery at 19) which prosecution weaponized against credibility.

quote_or_scene: Exley: 'Earlier we heard testimony from Brad Hayes, a delivery man for PHX, and he testified that he had some sort of relationship with you. Why would he say something like that?' Christine: 'I have no idea. I barely remember him.' Exley presents delivery schedule showing 40-minute average visits vs 12-minute neighborhood average over 9 months. Christine: 'I heard he was making rude comments about me' (reason she stopped using PHX).
notes: Brad Hayes called as defense witness at public trial. Christine claims 'I barely remember him' and 'absolutely not' to relationship question. However, she previously stopped using PHX delivery service 2 years prior because 'he was making rude comments about me'—suggesting preexisting allegation in community/neighborhood. Delivery records show pattern consistent with consensual relationship (40-min visits over 9 months). Public trial testimony exposes him to defamation as Christine denies everything under oath, calling him a liar. Implied innocent based on pattern matching Kevin's case and Christine's established pattern of false accusations.

consequence_detail: arrested, publicly_accused, vigilante_attack, broken_hand, hospitalization, reputation_damage
quote_or_scene: Stuart falsely claims: 'I heard him say, "You think you're special, bitch?" I recognized his voice.' Detectives arrest Henry: 'You tell him you're under arrest.' News report: 'Soho icon Henry Brazecki was beaten by vigilantes last night and hospitalized with a concussion and a broken hand.' Henry's alibis confirm: 'Three for three. Leslie, the pastry chef, his sister-in-law, all confirmed Henry's alibis.'
tags: ruined_in_family; media_outing; fabricated_claim; vigilante_attack; community_leader; public_confrontation
notes: Restaurant owner and community organizer falsely accused of being the West Soho serial rapist by Stuart, who planted hair evidence in Henry's car and lied about witnessing him rape Leslie. Henry was arrested, publicly exposed in media, and subsequently beaten by vigilantes (broken hand, concussion, hospitalization). His affairs with multiple women were exposed during investigation, damaging his marriage and reputation. Proven innocent when three alibi witnesses confirmed he was elsewhere during attacks. Stuart later confessed to being the actual rapist. Severity 4 due to vigilante attack causing serious injury plus extensive public/media exposure ruining reputation and marriage.

police_conduct_quote: Benson: 'If I wasn't a cop, I'd smack you around too.' Detectives physically force him down: 'Get on the floor... you're breaking it!'
quote_or_scene: Detectives publicly confront Andy at work in front of students. News footage: 'alleged rapist Andy Chen is attacked in broad daylight by five members of The Justice League.' Attorney: 'Here's a copy of the lawsuit I'm filing against you and the department for violating my client's civil rights.' Later cleared: 'Redheads, blondes, legs in the air. He's good for Monday night, but he's not our serial. A copycat.'
notes: Community college student, age 20, with prior subway groping offense. Guilty of ONE copycat rape (Claire Grant attack Monday night, DNA confirmed) but innocent of being the West Soho serial rapist. Detectives publicly questioned him at work in front of students, then arrested him. He was publicly identified in media as 'the West Soho rapist' and subsequently beaten by five vigilantes in broad daylight on camera. His attorney filed civil rights lawsuit. Though guilty of one rape, he was falsely accused of being the serial rapist (5+ other rapes) he did not commit. Included because of public exposure/vigilante harm stemming from the FALSE accusation of being the serial. Severity 3: arrest, workplace exposure, media identification, and serious vigilante beating.

quote_or_scene: Detectives approach Barnes at a public event while he's with his daughter Taylor. 'Dr. Barnes... these are detectives.' 'What's this about?' 'It's about your relationship with the daughters you fathered as a sperm donor.' His daughter witnesses this: 'Dad, what's wrong?' Later his daughter says: 'You're sick, daddy. How many kids do you have? A hundred? More? I could be dating one of my own brothers.' His wife also learns about his secret sperm donation through police questioning.
notes: Barnes is accused publicly at a family event in front of his teenage daughter. Three victims (Ashley, Melissa, Cate) initially tell police they met with 'their donor father' and had sexual relationships. Barnes is brought in for questioning, subjected to lineups, and DNA testing. His family learns he was a sperm donor (a secret from his wife) and initially believes he raped his donor daughters. His daughter Taylor is devastated and leaves home. DNA later proves he did not have sex with any of the victims - Sean Albers impersonated him. Barnes receives no apology from police.

quote_or_scene: Detectives track Kelly to North Jersey State Prison hospital wing where he works. 'Philip Kelly? NYPD.' Kelly responds: 'That's just great. What did I do now?' Detectives ask about his whereabouts and his relationship with Colin Barnes, clearly treating him as a suspect. Kelly provides alibi: 'Stuck at North Jersey State Prison, pulling a graveyard shift in the hospital wing.' When asked about Barnes' daughters: 'What are you talking about? Look, the only daughter I know is the teenager...'
notes: Kelly is investigated as a suspect due to his vendetta against Barnes (Barnes fired him). Police confront him at his workplace (prison hospital) treating him as a suspect in the sexual assaults. He provides alibi which clears him. The questioning occurs at his place of employment, exposing him to potential workplace consequences. No apology shown.

police_conduct_quote: You mean trying to take advantage of a vulnerable student... That would make him easy prey, right? / In my experience, boys this age, the stigma of homosexuality... don't usually make things like this up.
quote_or_scene: Joanne called me into the headmaster's office. They said that a student had made an accusation against me. They wouldn't tell me [who or what]. In this system, to be accused is to be guilty. I left a job that I loved, my wife left me, and I got beat up. / Mr. Simms, your wife sent an attorney. Said you can work out the legal fees during the divorce settlement.
tags: ruined_at_work; ruined_in_family; ruined_physically; perp_walk; fabricated_claim; teacher; arrested; fired; divorce; vigilante_attack
notes: Rick Simms is falsely accused by student Luca of exposing himself and propositioning him. School forces resignation without investigation. Luca's father has Simms beaten in staged gay-bashing attack. Simms is then arrested by SVU for sexual assault. Wife leaves him and sends divorce attorney. Eventually cleared when Luca recants and reveals actual abuser was Natalie Relais. Simms suffered job loss, marriage loss, violent assault, arrest, and public humiliation - all consequences of false accusation.

police_conduct_quote: He described your bed, and your pillow, and your book of poetry. Can you tell me how he would know those details? / He also knew about the birthmark on your inner thigh. How would he know that?
quote_or_scene: Joanne arrested at her home, bedroom searched, sheets bagged as evidence. Later: 'Joanne just tried to kill herself. Two hours ago, she filled her pockets with stones and walked into Prospect Park Lake.' Joanne: 'I never touched Luca. I would never touch a student... How could I say No, it's not Mr. Simms, it's Natalie? If I had told the truth... it would have destroyed her.'
tags: ruined_at_work; fabricated_claim; teacher; arrested; perp_walk; home_searched; suicide_attempt; public_confrontation
notes: Head of Upper School falsely accused by Luca after he recanted accusation against Simms. Luca and actual abuser Natalie fabricated accusation against Joanne as new cover story. Joanne arrested at home, bedroom searched with sheets seized, forced to expose birthmark. Attempted suicide by walking into lake with pockets filled with stones (Virginia Woolf-style). Was trying to protect Natalie (unrequited love interest) who was actually abusing Luca. Eventually cleared but suffered arrest, public humiliation, invasion of privacy, and near-death suicide attempt.

quote_or_scene: Detectives interrupt Pablo on a rooftop with his girlfriend Tiffany present, asking about Nina. Pablo says 'Who's Nina?' and later 'I broke up with Nina three months ago.' Tiffany is present during questioning. Pablo provides alibi that Nina came by at midnight but he turned her away because Tiffany was coming over.
notes: Pablo was questioned publicly on a rooftop with his current girlfriend Tiffany present, creating social embarrassment. He was cleared when he provided alibi and directed police to car service Nina used. No formal sanctions but public exposure in front of romantic partner qualifies as severity 2.

police_conduct_quote: Hey, wake up, Seth! We already got you for possession of stolen property, and you're this close to homicide.
quote_or_scene: Detectives stop Seth while he's trying to drop off a bike. Amaro threatens him: 'You're this close to homicide.' Seth is arrested and transported: 'Guess what. You're going for a ride. And you won't need your bicycle.' Seth eventually cleared when he explains Jess did the ear operations and he was just the 'steerer.'
notes: Seth was arrested on street while conducting business (dropping off bike), creating public exposure. Threatened with homicide charges. Cleared when investigation shifted to Jess and then Dr. Hal. Arrested and transported qualifies as severity 3.

police_conduct_quote: Detectives accuse her: 'You injected her with propofol, cut off her leg, except something went wrong, and Nina ended up dead.'
quote_or_scene: Jess arrested during 'Freak Night' event at Coney Island. Detective yells 'N.Y.P.D., stop! Drop the blade.' Arrested while performing body modification work. Later questioned about amputating Nina's leg. Detectives: 'You injected her with propofol, cut off her leg, except something went wrong, and Nina ended up dead.' Jess: 'I would never get involved in an operation like that... I would never subject someone to what I have been through.' Dr. Gene states: 'I fired her' after her arrest.
notes: Jess was arrested at public event (Freak Night) with witnesses present, then fired from dental office job. Accused of murder and amputation. Cleared when Dr. Hal identified as actual perpetrator. Lost employment and arrested qualifies as severity 3.

police_conduct_quote: Amaro: 'Not as much as a murder charge' in response to Gene's concern about being outed.
quote_or_scene: Dr. Gene questioned at his office about Nina's murder. Rollins: 'These medical-supply orders—a large bone saw—also no knowledge?' Amaro threatens: 'Not as much as a murder charge' when Gene expresses concern about privacy. Gene: 'These accusations are horrifying. I would—I would never be involved with this.' Later his brother Dr. Hal tries to frame him, telling detectives the pathology fits Gene. Detectives eventually realize Dr. Hal is the actual perpetrator.
notes: Dr. Gene was accused at his workplace (dental office) by detectives. While questioning appears to be in private office, his receptionist Jess was aware and present initially. Threatened with murder charges. His sexuality was used against him when he provided alibi. Brother attempted to frame him. Cleared when investigation pivoted to Dr. Hal. Workplace questioning qualifies as severity 2.

police_conduct_quote: And we'll be sure to call your wife and let her know you're okay.
quote_or_scene: BENSON: 'Thank you for your help, Mr. Dworkin. And we'll be sure to call your wife and let her know you're okay.' Context: Dworkin claims he met a girl and 'got lucky' - denies paying for sex. Detectives imply they know otherwise but have no proof he paid. He's released but threatened with wife being contacted.
notes: Dworkin is a sales conference attendee from Kansas City who was in a car accident with prostitute Pilar. He denies paying for sex, claims he 'got lucky.' Squad has no evidence he paid - girl won't say he paid, no money exchanged on record. The threat to contact his wife is pure intimidation with no criminal charge. He's actually innocent of solicitation - he was set up by the driver and pimp. The detectives use family exposure as leverage despite having no case.

quote_or_scene: BENSON: 'Hector Rodriguez, the Dominican kid... He was the exact same age. Missing boy, '99. Dad lost custody, took the kid back to the DR.' CRAGEN: 'We don't know that.' BENSON: 'The mother never saw her son again.' Later, BENSON: 'All these years we blamed his father.' Mother states: 'He doesn't have my son. Somebody else does.'
notes: Father was blamed for 13 years (1999-2012) for allegedly taking his son Hector back to the Dominican Republic during custody dispute. Mother confirms they stayed in touch with father's family and he didn't have Hector. Squad assumed parental abduction; actual perpetrator was Lewis Hodda. Father separated from mother over religious differences (Pentecostal vs Catholic custody dispute). Consequence: lost contact with son, blamed by authorities and possibly community for 13 years.

police_conduct_quote: MUNCH: 'You treated me like a skell instead of a cop.' LOMATIN: 'Like last time? You treated me like a skell instead of a cop.'
quote_or_scene: CRAGEN: 'Officer Lomatin, I apologize. The sergeant isn't running this investigation.' ROLLINS finds evidence in his apartment: 'He's got children's clothes, surveillance photos, blond hair dye, and disguises.' Alibi confirmed: 'Drugstore in Brooklyn has him on video at the pharmacy window when Wyatt was snatched.'
notes: Auxiliary officer who helped search for Hector in 1999 and Wyatt in 2012. Became suspect because: (1) found key evidence in both cases (Hector's lunch box in '99, Wyatt's cap in 2012), (2) sent anonymous letter to Hector's mother, (3) had obsessive archive of missing children cases with disguises/dye/clothes in his apartment. Cleared via drugstore video showing him picking up psychiatric medications (antidepressant, antianxiety, antipsychotic) at time of Wyatt's abduction. Was treated disrespectfully by Munch in both '99 and 2012 ('like a skell instead of a cop'). Cragen gave partial apology. Lomatin's pattern recognition about fires/abductions actually proved correct, vindicating his research. Consequence severity = 2 because he was publicly treated as suspect by multiple detectives, though no broader public exposure occurred.

police_conduct_quote: You got a little girl in here, Allen? Where is she? She's got that baby. Go find her!
quote_or_scene: Detectives confront Allen at his apartment: 'You're a sex offender and you were at the playground. What were you doing there this morning?' Allen explains he was cutting through after night shift. Mothers at park confirm they know him and call precinct when they see him. Allen tells detectives he saw a blond woman in floral dress take Tessa. Video later confirms his account.
notes: Allen is a registered sex offender known to mothers at the playground who photograph and report him. Despite being innocent of the kidnapping, he was arrested and interrogated aggressively. His account of seeing a woman take the baby proves accurate when video evidence confirms it. No apology shown.

quote_or_scene: Sam arrested on street, taken to court, remanded to custody. His son Dante witnesses the arrest aftermath: 'Dad!' 'I'm sorry, Dante.' 'All Dante wanted for Christmas was his father.' Judge: 'Defendant has three prior convictions, is currently on parole, and is accused of a brutal assault against a clergyman who is still hospitalized. The people request remand. Granted.' Father Shea later testifies: 'This was a good samaritan. He pulled the others off of me. He saved me from them.'
notes: Sam is a two-time felon on parole who intervened to save Father Shea from vigilantes. Despite being innocent, he was arrested publicly, remanded without bail through Christmas, and faced parole violation. His young son witnessed the aftermath. Father Shea, multiple detectives, security footage, and forensics all eventually proved his innocence. Released Christmas Eve by judge's conditional release.

quote_or_scene: Detectives question Father Shea extensively about being alone with Sofia at night. Amanda: 'How well do you know her?' Fin references the 'little girl in your car.' Nick: 'So you gave him good reason to attack you? Mistakes. Is that what you're calling what you did to Angelica? A mistake?' Shea: 'What? No. No. You have it wrong.' Liv eventually acknowledges: 'The men who beat you up were wrong. And we were wrong. You didn't molest Angelica. You didn't molest Sofia.'
notes: Father Shea was beaten by vigilantes who believed he was a pedophile because he was alone with a young girl. SVU detectives also suspected him throughout investigation due to circumstances and his transfer history. He was physically assaulted (beaten into a coma), publicly attacked as a 'chomo/short eyes,' and questioned as a suspect. Proven innocent - he had actually protected Angelica Rodriguez from Monsignor Menendez ten years prior and was transferred as punishment for breaking celibacy vows (Sofia is his biological daughter). The public beating and reputation damage qualify as harm even though police questioning was private.

quote_or_scene: Jessie arrested at murder scene in front of responding officers. 'What? I can't afford that. None of this is true. What about Matthew, my son? Who'll take care of him?' Court responds: 'The court will be in touch with social services.' Jessie screams 'Detective Benson, please tell him! Tell him I didn't do it! You know I didn't do this! Tell him!' Child placed in foster care while she's held on $200K bail.
tags: framed_for_murder; perp_walk; custody_loss; media_outing; fabricated_claim; CPS_involved; arrested; charged_then_dropped
